title: Aalen's Additive Hazard Models ‚Äî aalenhazard
text: Implements Aalen's additive hazard regression models survival data covariate effects additive rather multiplicative. approach particularly useful proportional hazards assumption violated, allowing time-varying covariate effects non-proportional hazards. model estimates cumulative regression functions can reveal covariate effects change time.

title: Aalen's Additive Hazard Models ‚Äî aalenhazard
code: aalenhazard(   data,   elapsedtime,   outcome,   covariates,   outcomeLevel = "1",   model_type = "additive",   constant_effects,   test_constant_effects = TRUE,   bandwidth = 1,   robust_se = TRUE,   show_model_summary = TRUE,   show_coefficients_table = TRUE,   show_test_results = TRUE,   show_cumulative_plots = TRUE,   show_hazard_plots = TRUE,   show_diagnostics = TRUE,   showSummaries = FALSE,   showExplanations = FALSE )

title: Aalen's Additive Hazard Models ‚Äî aalenhazard
text: data data data frame elapsedtime Survival time follow-duration variable outcome Event indicator variable (0/1, FALSE/TRUE, factor) covariates Covariate variables additive hazard modeling outcomeLevel Level outcome variable indicating event occurrence model_type Type Aalen hazard model fit constant_effects Variables treated constant (time-independent) effects test_constant_effects Test whether covariate effects constant time bandwidth Bandwidth parameter kernel smoothing cumulative coefficients robust_se Use robust sandwich estimator standard errors show_model_summary Display model summary table show_coefficients_table Display table cumulative regression coefficients show_test_results Display statistical test results show_cumulative_plots Display plots cumulative regression coefficients time show_hazard_plots Display estimated hazard function plots show_diagnostics Display model diagnostic plots residuals showSummaries Generate natural language summaries results showExplanations Show detailed methodology explanations

code: # Example 1: Basic Aalen additive hazard model library(timereg) #> Loading required package: survival #>  #> Attaching package: ‚Äòsurvival‚Äô #> The following objects are masked from ‚Äòpackage:ClinicoPath‚Äô: #>  #>     colon, finegray library(survival)  aalenhazard(     data = veteran_data,     elapsedtime = "time",     outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1",     covariates = c("age", "karno", "diagtime"),     model_type = "additive" ) #> Error in aalenhazard(data = veteran_data, elapsedtime = "time", outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1", covariates = c("age", "karno", "diagtime"),     model_type = "additive"): argument "constant_effects" is missing, with no default  # Example 2: Semi-parametric Aalen model with constant effects aalenhazard(     data = lung_data,     elapsedtime = "time",     outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "2",     covariates = c("age", "sex", "ph.ecog"),     model_type = "semiparametric",     constant_effects = c("sex"),     show_cumulative_plots = TRUE ) #> Error: Argument 'elapsedtime' contains 'time' which is not present in the dataset

what: Adaptive LASSO for Cox Models ‚Äî adaptivelasso
title: Adaptive LASSO for Cox Models ‚Äî adaptivelasso
text: Adaptive LASSO Cox proportional hazards models data-driven penalty selection improved variable selection properties. Unlike standard LASSO, adaptive LASSO uses weights based initial parameter estimates provide consistent variable selection (oracle property) reduced bias non-zero coefficients. implementation supports multiple weight calculation methods, cross-validation optimal penalty selection, stability selection robust variable identification, comprehensive model diagnostics. Particularly effective high-dimensional survival data traditional methods fail, genomic studies many biomarkers, clinical prediction models requiring sparse, interpretable solutions. method automatically handles tied survival times, stratified analysis, provides uncertainty quantification bootstrap procedures.

title: Adaptive LASSO for Cox Models ‚Äî adaptivelasso
code: adaptivelasso(   data,   time,   event,   predictors,   strata,   weight_method = "ridge",   alpha = 1,   gamma = 1,   cv_folds = 10,   cv_measure = "deviance",   lambda_sequence = "auto",   lambda_min_ratio = 0.001,   n_lambda = 100,   stability_selection = FALSE,   stability_threshold = 0.6,   bootstrap_samples = 100,   subsampling_ratio = 0.8,   proportional_hazards = TRUE,   influence_diagnostics = FALSE,   goodness_of_fit = TRUE,   risk_groups = 3,   time_points = "1, 2, 5",   baseline_survival = TRUE,   show_coefficients = TRUE,   show_selection_path = TRUE,   show_cv_results = TRUE,   show_diagnostics = TRUE,   plot_selection_path = TRUE,   plot_cv_curve = TRUE,   plot_stability = FALSE,   plot_survival_curves = FALSE,   plot_baseline_hazard = FALSE,   plot_diagnostics = FALSE,   tie_method = "breslow",   standardize = TRUE,   intercept = FALSE,   parallel_computing = FALSE,   n_cores = 2,   convergence_threshold = 1e-07,   max_iterations = 10000,   random_seed = 123 )

title: Adaptive LASSO for Cox Models ‚Äî adaptivelasso
text: data data data frame. time Time event variable (numeric). right-censored data,  time study entry event censoring. event Event indicator variable. survival analysis: 0 = censored, 1 = event. competing risks: 0 = censored, 1+ = different event types. predictors Variables include adaptive LASSO Cox model. Can include continuous, ordinal, nominal variables. Automatic standardization applied optimal penalty performance. strata Optional stratification variable stratified Cox regression. Creates separate baseline hazards stratum. weight_method Method calculating adaptive weights. Ridge provides stable weights shrinkage, univariate uses individual Cox regressions, full Cox uses complete model (may unstable), correlation uses marginal associations. alpha Elastic net mixing parameter. 1.0 = pure LASSO, 0.0 = ridge regression, intermediate values combine penalties better performance correlated predictors. gamma Power parameter adaptive weights calculation. Higher values increase penalty differences variables, promoting stronger variable selection potentially increasing instability. cv_folds Number folds cross-validation select optimal penalty parameter. folds provide better estimates increase computation time. cv_measure Performance measure cross-validation. Deviance computationally efficient, C-index focuses discrimination, Brier score accounts calibration, AUC provides time-specific performance. lambda_sequence specify penalty parameter sequence. Automatic uses data-driven range, custom allows user specification, single tests one value. lambda_min_ratio Ratio smallest largest lambda value automatic sequence. Smaller values explore stronger penalties may lead computational difficulties. n_lambda Number lambda values regularization path. values provide finer resolution increase computation time. stability_selection Perform stability selection identify robust variable selection patterns across bootstrap samples. Provides reliable variable selection single model fitting. stability_threshold Minimum selection frequency variables stability selection. Higher thresholds provide conservative variable selection may miss important predictors. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples stability selection confidence intervals. samples provide stable estimates. subsampling_ratio Proportion data used bootstrap sample stability selection. Smaller ratios increase selection variability. proportional_hazards Test proportional hazards assumption selected variables using scaled Schoenfeld residuals time-interaction tests. influence_diagnostics Calculate influence diagnostics including dfbeta, leverage, outlier detection robust model assessment. goodness_of_fit Perform goodness fit assessment including model deviance, concordance statistics, calibration measures. risk_groups Number risk groups stratification based linear predictor. Used Kaplan-Meier curves risk group analysis. time_points Comma-separated list time points survival probability predictions. Empty string uses data-driven quantiles. baseline_survival Estimate plot baseline survival function adaptive LASSO Cox model using Breslow estimator. show_coefficients Display coefficient estimates selected variables standard errors confidence intervals. show_selection_path Display complete regularization path showing coefficients change penalty parameter. show_cv_results Display cross-validation results including optimal lambda selection performance across penalty values. show_diagnostics Display comprehensive model diagnostics including proportional hazards tests, influence measures, residual analysis. plot_selection_path Plot coefficient paths function penalty parameter showing variable selection progression. plot_cv_curve Plot cross-validation performance curve optimal lambda selection confidence bands. plot_stability Plot stability selection results showing selection frequencies across bootstrap samples. plot_survival_curves Plot Kaplan-Meier survival curves risk groups defined adaptive LASSO linear predictor. plot_baseline_hazard Plot estimated baseline hazard function cumulative baseline hazard final model. plot_diagnostics Create diagnostic plots including residuals, influential observations, proportional hazards assessment. tie_method Method handling tied survival times. Efron provides better approximation computationally intensive. standardize Standardize predictors fitting. Recommended optimal penalty performance mixed-scale variables. intercept Include intercept term Cox model. Generally needed survival analysis may useful special cases. parallel_computing Use parallel computing cross-validation bootstrap procedures reduce computation time. n_cores Number CPU cores parallel computation enabled. cores speed CV bootstrap use memory. convergence_threshold Convergence threshold coordinate descent algorithm. Smaller values provide precise solutions increase computation time. max_iterations Maximum iterations coordinate descent algorithm. Increase convergence warnings occur. random_seed Random seed cross-validation folds bootstrap sampling. Ensures reproducible results across analyses.

code: advancedSurvivalPower(   data,   calc_type = "sample_size",   study_design = "simple",   hazard_ratio = 0.7,   power = 0.8,   alpha = 0.05,   sample_size = 200,   allocation_ratio = 1,   prob_event = 0.5,   accrual_time = 1,   follow_up_time = 3,   median_survival = 5,   loss_followup = 0.05 )

title: Advanced Survival Power Analysis (Advanced) ‚Äî advancedSurvivalPower
text: data data data frame. Note power analysis typically require actual data - used study planning. calc_type Select calculate. 'Power' calculates statistical power given sample size hazard ratio. 'Sample Size' determines required sample size desired power hazard ratio. 'Hazard Ratio' calculates minimum detectable effect size given sample size power. study_design Select study design complexity. 'Simple' assumes fixed follow-period subjects. 'Complex' allows accrual period variable follow-times. hazard_ratio hazard ratio detect. Values < 1 indicate protective effects (treatment better control); values > 1 indicate harmful effects (control better treatment). power probability detecting effect one exists (1 minus Type II error rate). Conventional values 0.8 0.9. alpha Type error rate (probability falsely rejecting null hypothesis). Conventional value 0.05. sample_size total number subjects across groups. sample size calculation, starting value search algorithm. allocation_ratio ratio control group size treatment group size. 1 indicates equal allocation. Values > 1 mean subjects control group; values < 1 mean treatment group. prob_event overall probability observing event (e.g., death) study period. affects number events observed, crucial power. accrual_time period participants recruited, years. used complex designs. follow_up_time additional follow-period accrual ends, years. used complex designs. median_survival median survival time control group, years. Used estimate baseline hazard rate. used complex designs. loss_followup annual rate loss follow-(attrition). used complex designs.

title: Advanced Survival Power Analysis (Advanced) ‚Äî advancedSurvivalPower
code: # \donttest{ # Example 1: Calculate required sample size for a cancer treatment study # Detect 30\% reduction in hazard (HR=0.7) with 80\% power # advancedSurvivalPower( #   data = data.frame(), #   calc_type = "sample_size", #   hazard_ratio = 0.7, #   power = 0.8, #   alpha = 0.05, #   prob_event = 0.6,          # 60\% event rate over study period #   allocation_ratio = 1       # Equal allocation # )  # Example 2: Calculate power for an existing study design # advancedSurvivalPower( #   data = data.frame(), #   calc_type = "power", #   hazard_ratio = 0.75,       # Modest treatment effect #   sample_size = 300,         # Available sample size #   alpha = 0.05, #   prob_event = 0.4,          # 40\% event rate #   allocation_ratio = 2       # 2:1 control:treatment ratio # )  # Example 3: Find minimum detectable effect size # advancedSurvivalPower( #   data = data.frame(), #   calc_type = "hazard_ratio", #   sample_size = 200, #   power = 0.8, #   alpha = 0.05, #   prob_event = 0.5 # )  # Example 4: Complex design with accrual and follow-up periods # advancedSurvivalPower( #   data = data.frame(), #   calc_type = "sample_size", #   study_design = "complex", #   hazard_ratio = 0.7, #   power = 0.8, #   alpha = 0.05, #   accrual_time = 3,          # 3 years to recruit patients #   follow_up_time = 2,        # 2 additional years follow-up #   median_survival = 5,       # 5 years median survival in control #   loss_followup = 0.05       # 5\% annual loss to follow-up # ) # }

(weight/height^2)") ridge_penalty Ridge penalty numerical stability regression imputation remove_collinear Automatically remove highly collinear variables imputation model collinearity_threshold Correlation threshold removing collinear variables diagnostic_plots Generate convergence diagnostic plots imputation_quality Assess quality imputations vs observed data cross_validation Perform seed reproducible results

bound normal reference range (shaded area). show_mcid Display Minimal Clinically Important Difference band. mcid_value Size Minimal Clinically Important Difference. show_effect_size Show effect size title: Clinical Trial Test Datasets for Advanced Raincloud Plot ‚Äî advancedraincloud_datasets
text: Patient Identifiers: patient_id Unique patient identifier (PT001-PT300) treatment_arm Treatment group - factor levels "Placebo", "Drug " time_point Visit timepoint - factor levels "Baseline", "Week 4", "Week 12" visit_number Numeric visit number (1-3) Demographics: age Patient age years (normally distributed, mean=55, sd=12) gender Patient gender - factor levels "Female", "Male" disease_stage Disease stage - factor levels "Early", "Advanced" biomarker_status Biomarker status - factor levels "Negative", "Positive" age_group Age stratification - factor "< 65 years", "‚â• 65 years" baseline_biomarker_high Baseline biomarker level - factor "High", "Normal" Primary Outcomes: tumor_size_change Percent change tumor size baseline (negative = shrinkage) biomarker_level Biomarker concentration (log-normally distributed, ~90 units baseline) qol_score Quality life score (0-100 scale, higher = better) pain_score Pain intensity score - ordered factor (0-10 scale, higher = worse pain) Derived Variables: tumor_responder Response classification - factor levels: "Progressive Disease" (>10% increase) "Stable Disease" (-10% +10%) "Partial Response" (-30% -10%) "Complete Response" (‚â§-30%) Change Score Variables (advancedraincloud_change ): tumor_change Change tumor size (Week 12 - Baseline) biomarker_change Change biomarker (Baseline - Week 12, positive = reduction) qol_change Change quality life (Week 12 - Baseline) pain_change Change pain score (Baseline - Week 12, positive = improvement)

title: Clinical Trial Test Datasets for Advanced Raincloud Plot ‚Äî advancedraincloud_datasets
text: simulates randomized, placebo-controlled trial : N = 300 patients (150 per arm) 3 timepoints: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12 Primary endpoint: Tumor size reduction Secondary endpoints: Biomarker levels, quality life, pain scores Realistic dropout: ~15% overall, higher placebo group Missing data: Increases time, varies treatment

title: Clinical Trial Test Datasets for Advanced Raincloud Plot ‚Äî advancedraincloud_datasets
text: simulated treatment effects : Placebo Slight tumor progression (+5% Week 4, +8% Week 12) Drug Tumor regression (-15% Week 4, -25% Week 12) 30% non-responders Biomarkers Drug reduces levels ~40%, Placebo shows slight increase Quality Life Drug improves scores (+8 points), Placebo slight decline (-2) Pain Scores Drug reduces pain (-1.5 points), Placebo slight increase (+0.5)

title: Clinical Trial Test Datasets for Advanced Raincloud Plot ‚Äî advancedraincloud_datasets
text: datasets designed test Advanced Raincloud Plot features: Clinical Significance: Clinical cutoffs (e.g., tumor_size_change = -30 response) Reference ranges (e.g., biomarker_level: 10-50 normal range) MCID values (e.g., qol_score MCID = 10 points) Effect Size Analysis: -group comparisons (Drug vs Placebo) Cohen's d, Hedges' g, Glass's delta calculations Multiple timepoint comparisons Change Score Analysis: Longitudinal change baseline Responder classifications (20% threshold default) Missing data handling Biomarker Features: Log-normal distribution requiring transformation Outliers (10 extreme values) outlier handling tests CV bands assay variability assessment Publication Features: Sample size annotations Missing data reporting Statistical comparisons Journal-specific formatting

code: # Basic raincloud plot with clinical cutoff advancedraincloud(   data = advancedraincloud_baseline,   y_var = "biomarker_level",   x_var = "treatment_arm",   clinical_cutoff = 100,   show_sample_size = TRUE )  # Longitudinal analysis with change scores advancedraincloud(   data = advancedraincloud_data,   y_var = "tumor_size_change",   x_var = "time_point",   id_var = "patient_id",   fill_var = "treatment_arm",   show_longitudinal = TRUE,   show_change_scores = TRUE,   baseline_group = "Baseline",   clinical_cutoff = -30,   show_effect_size = TRUE )  # Biomarker analysis with log transformation advancedraincloud(   data = advancedraincloud_endpoint,   y_var = "biomarker_level",   x_var = "treatment_arm",   log_transform = TRUE,   outlier_method = "winsorize",   reference_range_min = 10,   reference_range_max = 50,   show_cv_bands = TRUE,   journal_style = "nature" )  # Quality of life with MCID analysis advancedraincloud(   data = advancedraincloud_data,   y_var = "qol_score",   x_var = "time_point",   fill_var = "treatment_arm",   show_mcid = TRUE,   mcid_value = 10,   show_change_scores = TRUE,   generate_report = TRUE )  # Likert scale analysis for pain scores advancedraincloud(   data = advancedraincloud_data,   y_var = "pain_score",   x_var = "treatment_arm",   likert_mode = TRUE,   show_comparisons = TRUE,   p_value_position = "above" )

title: Advanced Clinical Trial Methods ‚Äî advancedtrials
text: Advanced clinical trial methodologies including group sequential designs, adaptive trials, interim monitoring. Provides sophisticated statistical methods non-inferiority trials, futility analysis, early stopping rules. Implements cutting-edge designs seamless Phase II/III, platform trials, master protocol studies. Designed clinical trialists requiring state---art methodology regulatory compliance.

title: Advanced Clinical Trial Methods ‚Äî advancedtrials

control) biomarker_var Biomarker enrichment stratification strategies interim_time_var Calendar time interim analysis stratification_vars Variables stratified randomization design_type Advanced clinical trial design type primary_endpoint Primary efficacy endpoint statistical_test Statistical test primary analysis alpha_spending Alpha spending function efficacy boundaries beta_spending Beta Expected treatment effect (hazard ratio) accrual_rate Expected patient accrual rate dropout_rate Annual patient dropout rate number_of_arms Total number treatment arms control_arm_sharing Share control arm across comparisons interim_arm_addition Allow adding arms trial interim_arm_dropping Allow dropping arms futility biomarker_strategy Biomarker-driven design strategy biomarker_prevalence Prevalence positive biomarker futility_analysis Include formal futility testing stochastic_curtailment Use stochastic curtailment approach predictive_power_threshold Threshold futility based efficacy futility boundary plots conditional_power_analysis Calculate conditional power interim analyses predictive_power_analysis Calculate predictive power study completion bias_adjustment Apply title: Interrater Reliability ‚Äî agreement
text: data data data frame. data long format, row unique observation. vars string naming variable data contains diagnosis given observer. baConfidenceLevel Confidence level Bland-Altman limits agreement (LoA). Typically 0.95 95\ proportionalBiasTest whether difference raters changes systematically magnitude measurement (proportional bias). Uses linear regression difference vs. mean. blandAltmanPlotGenerate Bland-Altman plot continuous agreement analysis. Displays mean difference limits agreement first two raters. applicable raters provide continuous measurements (e.g., tumor size mm). agreementHeatmapGenerate heatmap visualization agreement patterns categorical data. Creates confusion matrices showing rater pair's classifications correspond. Color-coded cells reveal agreement (diagonal) specific disagreement patterns (-diagonal). Essential identifying systematic biases, problematic categories, training needs. Shows raters agree strongly, consistently disagree, category confusions common. Particularly valuable multi-category classifications complex disagreement patterns. heatmapColorSchemeColor palette heatmap visualization. Blue-Red highlights diagonal agreement strong contrast. Traffic light uses intuitive color coding. Viridis perceptually uniform colorblind-safe. Grayscale black--white printing. heatmapShowPercentagesDisplay percentage values within heatmap cells (percentage total cases). Helps interpret relative frequency rater combination. Essential comparing heatmaps different sample sizes. heatmapShowCountsDisplay absolute counts within heatmap cells (number cases). Shows actual sample sizes cell. Useful identifying cells insufficient data assessing statistical reliability. heatmapAnnotationSizeText size cell annotations (counts percentages). Adjust readability different numbers categories. Larger categories, smaller many categories. showAgreementHeatmapGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Agreement Heatmap running analysis. sftDisplay frequency tables showing distribution ratings rater. Useful understanding rating patterns identifying potential biases. wghtFor ordinal variables (e.g., tumor grade G1/G2/G3), weighted kappa accounts degree disagreement. Linear weights: Adjacent disagreements (G1 vs G2) receive partial credit. Squared weights: Larger disagreements (G1 vs G3) penalized heavily. Use 'Unweighted' nominal categories inherent order. exctUse exact p-value calculation instead normal approximation. Recommended small sample sizes (< 30 cases) 3 raters. Note: applicable 2-rater analysis (use Cohen's kappa). showLevelInfoDisplay information categorical levels currently ordered variables. Essential weighted kappa analysis ensure ordinal levels properly ordered (e.g., G1 ‚Üí G2 ‚Üí G3 tumor grades). krippAlternative reliability measure handles missing data supports various data types. Useful raters rate cases comparing different measurement levels. krippMethodSpecifies measurement level Krippendorff's alpha calculation. bootstrapCalculate bootstrap confidence intervals Krippendorff's alpha. gwetAlternative agreement coefficient stable Cohen's kappa dealing high agreement rates unbalanced marginal distributions (e.g., rare tumor subtypes). Gwet's AC corrects paradoxical behavior kappa extreme cases. gwetWeightsUnweighted (AC1) nominal categories. Linear Quadratic weights (AC2) ordinal data. iccIntraclass Correlation Coefficient continuous measurements (e.g., tumor size mm, biomarker concentrations). Standard measure assessing agreement numeric data. Complements Bland-Altman analysis. iccTypeICC model selection. One-way: subject rated different raters. Two-way: subjects rated raters. Random: raters random sample. Mixed: raters fixed. Single: reliability individual rater. Average (k): reliability mean rating. meanPearsonMean Pearson Correlation calculates average linear correlation coefficient across rater pairs continuous measurements. Pearson's r measures linear association variables, ranging -1 (perfect negative) +1 (perfect positive correlation). interrater agreement, high positive correlations indicate raters' measurements vary together linearly. Particularly useful continuous scales (tumor size, biomarker levels, quantitative scores), assumes linear relationship normality. Complements ICC focusing correlation rather absolute agreement. Simple, interpretable measure assessing whether raters rank scale measurements similarly. showMeanPearsonGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Mean Pearson Correlation running analysis. linCCCLin's Concordance Correlation Coefficient (CCC) measures precision accuracy continuous data, making superior Pearson's r method comparison agreement studies. CCC ranges -1 +1 (perfect concordance) equals product Pearson's r (precision) bias correction factor (accuracy). Unlike Pearson's r measures linear association, CCC penalizes systematic bias. Essential method comparison (manual vs. automated), instrument validation, assessing measurement agreement. Requires 2 raters/methods pairwise comparison; calculates pairwise CCCs 3+ raters. showLinCCCGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Lin's Concordance Correlation Coefficient running analysis. tdiTotal Deviation Index (TDI) quantifies limits within specified proportion differences two measurement methods fall. Unlike Bland-Altman assumes constant variability, TDI accounts heteroscedastic errors (variance increasing magnitude). Provides single index acceptable agreement based predefined clinically acceptable limits. Essential medical device validation, laboratory method comparison, biomarker assay validation regulatory agencies require demonstration specified percentage measurements fall within acceptable limits. Requires 2 raters/methods. Particularly useful establishing equivalence manual automated measurements different measurement platforms. tdiCoverageThe proportion differences fall within TDI limits (default: 90\ stringent requirements. defines percentage future measurements must fall within acceptable limits. tdiLimitMaximum acceptable difference methods original units. Example: tumor size, 5mm might clinically acceptable. TDI smaller limit methods considered equivalent. showTDIGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Total Deviation Index running analysis. iotaIota coefficient multivariate interrater agreement. Measures agreement raters assess multiple variables simultaneously (e.g., tumor size + grade + mitotic count). Unlike ICC analyzes one variable time, Iota provides single chance-corrected agreement index across variables. Supports quantitative (continuous) nominal (categorical) data. Reduces Fleiss' kappa single categorical variable. iotaStandardizeZ-standardize quantitative variables computing Iota. Recommended variables different scales (e.g., tumor size mm vs. Ki-67 percentage). Ensures variable contributes equally overall agreement measure. finnFinn coefficient interrater reliability categorical data. Variance-based agreement measure especially useful variance raters low (.e., agreement high). Alternative traditional kappa-based measures. Works ordered categorical ratings. finnLevelsThe number different rating categories Finn coefficient calculation (e.g., 3 low/medium/high, 5 5-point Likert scale). Must specify total number distinct categories rating scale. finnModelModel specification Finn coefficient. One-way: subjects random effects (subject may rated different raters). Two-way: subjects raters random (subjects raters randomly chosen larger populations). lightKappaAlternative agreement measure 3 raters. Calculates average pairwise kappas raters. robust Fleiss' kappa raters different marginal distributions assumptions Fleiss' kappa questionable. kendallWKendall's coefficient concordance (W) measures agreement among raters rating ranking ordinal data. W ranges 0 (agreement) 1 (perfect agreement). Particularly useful ranked data, severity scores, ordinal grading systems want know raters rank cases similar order. robinsonARobinson's agreement coefficient ordinal data based proportion concordant pairs. ranges -1 (complete disagreement) 1 (perfect agreement), 0 indicating agreement better chance. Alternative weighted kappa directly measures degree ordinal association raters. Particularly useful ordinal categories meaningful rank order (e.g., disease severity stages, tumor grades). Less affected marginal distribution imbalances kappa-based measures. showRobinsonAGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Robinson's running analysis. meanSpearmanMean Spearman Rho calculates average rank correlation across rater pairs. Spearman's rho nonparametric measure monotonic association ordinal data. ranges -1 (perfect negative association) +1 (perfect positive association), 0 indicating association. used interrater agreement, high positive values indicate raters rank cases similarly. Particularly useful ordinal scales, rankings, severity ratings. Robust outliers assume linear relationship. Complements ordinal measures (Robinson's , Kendall's W) focusing rank-order correlation rather exact concordance. showMeanSpearmanGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Mean Spearman Rho running analysis. raterBiasTests whether raters systematically different rating patterns (e.g., one rater lenient/strict others). Uses chi-square test detect marginal frequencies differ significantly across raters. Essential quality control tool identify raters consistently -diagnose -diagnose compared peers. bhapkarBhapkar test marginal homogeneity two raters multiple categories. powerful alternative Stuart-Maxwell test. Like McNemar's test >2 categories. Tests two raters use rating categories equal frequency. Essential paired comparisons (e.g., pre-post training, novice vs. expert, pathologist vs. AI algorithm) detect systematic differences category usage. stuartMaxwellStuart-Maxwell test marginal homogeneity two raters multiple categories. Classic test matched data analysis. Like McNemar's test >2 categories. Tests two raters use rating categories equal frequency. Note: Bhapkar test powerful large samples, Stuart-Maxwell traditional choice. Use paired/matched comparisons detect systematic category usage differences. maxwellREMaxwell's Random Error (RE) index decomposes total measurement variance systematic random error components. RE represents proportion total disagreement attributable random measurement error rather systematic differences raters methods. Values range 0 (error systematic) 1 (error random). Essential understanding error sources method comparison studies, diagnostic test validation, measurement reliability assessment. Typically used continuous ordinal data requiring 2+ raters/methods. showMaxwellREGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Maxwell's RE running analysis. interIntraRaterSimultaneous assessment inter-rater intra-rater reliability test-retest studies. Calculates intra-rater reliability (rater consistency across time) inter-rater reliability (agreement different raters). Requires paired columns representing rater different time points (e.g., Rater1_Time1, Rater1_Time2). Essential training evaluation, fatigue studies, long-term reliability assessment. Reports within-rater consistency -rater agreement. interIntraSeparatorCharacter separating rater ID time point column names (default: underscore). Example: separator "", columns named "Rater1_T1" "Rater1_T2" recognized rater two time points. Common patterns: underscore (), dot (.), dash (-). showInterIntraRaterGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Inter/Intra-Rater Reliability running analysis. pairwiseKappaCompare rater individually reference rater (e.g., gold standard, consensus score, senior pathologist). Produces individual kappa values rater-vs-reference comparison. Essential training assessment, rater certification, performance monitoring. referenceRaterSelect reference rater variable (e.g., consensus score, gold standard diagnosis, senior pathologist ratings). rater main variable list compared pairwise reference using Cohen's kappa. rankRatersRank raters highest lowest kappa (relative reference). Shows best worst performing raters quality control training needs. Useful identifying raters need additional training ready certification. hierarchicalKappaEnable hierarchical (multilevel) kappa analysis nested data structures (e.g., pathologists nested within institutions, readers nested within centers). Accounts clustering effects provides institution/cluster-specific agreement estimates. Essential multi-center reliability studies. clusterVariableVariable defining clusters/institutions/centers. example, hospital ID, institution name, scanner ID. Raters nested within clusters. iccHierarchicalCalculate intraclass correlation coefficients hierarchical data. ICC(1): -cluster agreement, ICC(2): reliability cluster means, ICC(3): within-cluster agreement. Decomposes variance cluster-level rater-level components. clusterSpecificKappaCalculate kappa separately cluster/institution identify sites poor agreement. Useful quality control multi-center studies. varianceDecompositionDecompose total variance -cluster within-cluster components. Large -cluster variance indicates institutional heterogeneity. Comparison informs whether issues local systematic. shrinkageEstimatesCalculate shrinkage estimates cluster-specific kappas. Shrinks extreme estimates toward overall mean, providing stable estimates small clusters. Recommended cluster sizes vary substantially. testClusterHomogeneityTest whether agreement homogeneous across clusters (null hypothesis: clusters equal kappa). Significant result indicates heterogeneity requiring investigation. clusterRankingsRank clusters/institutions agreement performance confidence intervals. Identifies best worst performing sites. Use cautiously avoid unfair comparisons cluster sizes differ substantially. specificAgreementCalculate category-specific agreement indices binary multi-category data. binary data: Positive Specific Agreement (PSA) Negative Specific Agreement (NSA). multi-category data: Agreement indices category separately. Essential categories clinically important others (e.g., cancer diagnosis, adverse events, critical findings). Unlike overall kappa treats disagreements equally, specific agreement focuses agreement within category, revealing categories reliable agreement need attention. specificPositiveCategoryFor binary specific agreement: Specify category treated "positive" (e.g., "Cancer", "Malignant", "Present", "Yes", "1"). Leave blank calculate specific agreement categories. Required PSA/NSA interpretation. Example: categories "Benign" "Malignant", enter "Malignant". specificAllCategoriesCalculate specific agreement category separately (recommended). enabled, provides agreement indices every category data, identifying specific diagnoses/classifications strong agreement may need improved training criteria clarification. specificConfidenceIntervalsCalculate 95\ specific agreement indices using Wilson score method. Recommended publication sample sizes vary across categories. Helps distinguish true differences category-specific agreement random variation. showSpecificAgreementGuideShow educational guide clinical use cases Specific Agreement Indices running analysis. showSummaryDisplay natural-language interpretation results color-coded agreement levels clinical guidance. Recommended reports presentations. showAboutDisplay explanatory panel describing analysis , use , interpret results. consensusNameName new computed variable containing consensus ratings. added dataset available downstream analyses. consensusRuleRule defining consensus. Simple majority = modal category >50\ Unanimous requires 100\ NA consensus variable. tieBreakerHow handle ties single category meets consensus threshold (e.g., 2-2 split 4 raters). Exclude = set consensus NA tied cases. First = use first category appears. Lowest/Highest = use min/max tied categories. loaVariableCalculate agreement level case add new computed column. Choose Simple (3 categories) Detailed (5 categories) classification. Useful identifying difficult cases quality control. detailLevelSimple mode: Agreed (100\ (‚â•threshold\ (100\ thresholds). Simple mode replicates former "Agreement Status" feature. simpleThresholdFor Simple mode : Minimum \ Agreed" status. 50\ unanimous. loaThresholdsFor Detailed mode : define 5 LoA categories. Custom = user-defined cutpoints. Quartiles/Tertiles = data-driven splits. loaHighThresholdFor Detailed mode Custom thresholds : Minimum \ threshold "High Agreement". loaLowThresholdFor Detailed mode Custom thresholds : Minimum \ "Poor", Low High = "Moderate". loaVariableNameName computed Level Agreement variable added dataset. Default: 'agreement_level'. contain categories like 'Absolute', 'High', 'Moderate', 'Low', 'Poor'. showLoaTableDisplay summary table showing distribution cases across LoA categories counts percentages. Useful quality control reporting. raterProfilesGenerate box plots violin plots showing distribution ratings rater. categorical data: bar plots showing category distribution per rater. continuous data: box plots/violin plots showing rating distribution per rater. Essential identifying raters systematically different rating patterns (e.g., consistently higher/lower scores, restricted range use, bimodal distributions). Reveals rating style differences, scale use patterns, potential training needs. Particularly valuable agreement low - helps determine disagreement stems systematic differences rating distributions random variation. raterProfileTypeFor continuous data: Choose box plots (shows median, quartiles, outliers) violin plots (shows full distribution shape including multimodality). categorical data: Automatically uses bar plots showing category frequencies. raterProfileShowPointsOverlay individual rating observations box/violin plots. Useful smaller datasets (N < 100) show actual data distribution. recommended large datasets due overplotting. showRaterProfileGuide. agreementBySubgroupCalculate agreement statistics separately level subgroup variable (e.g., tumor type, disease stage, specimen type, difficulty level). Generates forest plot showing kappa/ICC values confidence intervals across subgroups. Essential determining whether agreement consistent across different contexts varies case characteristics. Common use cases: comparing agreement benign vs. malignant cases, early vs. advanced stage, different anatomical sites, easy vs. difficult cases. Reveals whether rater training adequate case types whether specific subgroups need targeted attention. subgroupVariableCategorical variable defining subgroups stratified analysis. Examples: tumor_type, disease_stage, specimen_site, difficulty_level. Agreement calculated separately level variable. subgroupForestPlotCreate forest plot showing agreement estimates (kappa/ICC) confidence intervals subgroup. Facilitates visual comparison agreement across subgroups. subgroupMinCasesMinimum number cases required subgroup calculate agreement statistics. Subgroups fewer cases excluded warning message. Default: 10 cases (reasonable kappa estimation). showSubgroupGuide. raterClusteringCluster raters based rating patterns identify groups raters similar rating behavior. continuous data: clustering based correlation Euclidean distance ratings. categorical data: clustering based agreement patterns confusion matrices. Essential identifying subgroups raters rate similarly, detecting outlier raters, understanding rater training backgrounds, optimizing panel composition. Reveals whether raters form natural groups (e.g., experienced vs. novice, different training backgrounds) rate independently. Useful targeted training interventions understanding sources disagreement. clusterMethodHierarchical clustering: Creates dendrogram showing nested rater groupings similarity levels. Best exploring natural groupings without pre-specifying number clusters. K-means: Partitions raters K distinct clusters. Requires specifying number clusters. Best number groups known priori (e.g., 2 training cohorts, 3 experience levels). clusterDistanceFor continuous data: - Correlation: Groups raters similar relative rating patterns (recommended cases) - Euclidean: Groups raters similar absolute rating values - Manhattan: Like Euclidean less sensitive outliers categorical data: - Agreement-based: Distance = 1 - pairwise agreement proportion Correlation recommended applications captures rating pattern similarity regardless systematic shifts (one rater consistently 10\ higher). clusterLinkageHow measure distance clusters: - Average: Distance cluster means (balanced, recommended cases) - Complete: Maximum distance two points (compact clusters) - Single: Minimum distance two points (can create chain-like clusters) - Ward: Minimizes within-cluster variance (tends create equal-sized clusters) nClustersNumber clusters create k-means clustering. Consider: number training cohorts, experience levels, institutions. hierarchical clustering, ignored dendrogram can cut height. showDendrogramDisplay hierarchical clustering dendrogram showing rater groupings similarity levels. Height joins indicates dissimilarity. Raters joined lower heights similar. Useful identifying natural number clusters understanding rater relationships. showClusterHeatmapDisplay heatmap pairwise rater similarities cluster memberships annotated. Helps visualize raters similar validates cluster assignments. continuous data: correlation matrix. categorical data: agreement matrix. showRaterClusterGuide. caseClusteringPerform clustering cases based rating patterns across raters. Identifies groups cases received similar ratings. caseClusterMethodHierarchical: Creates dendrogram showing nested groupings similarity levels. K-means: Partitions cases K distinct clusters (continuous data ). caseClusterDistanceCorrelation (1 - r): Based correlation rating vectors (continuous). Euclidean: Straight-line distance rating space. Manhattan: City-block distance (sum absolute differences). Agreement-Based: Proportion disagreeing raters (categorical). caseClusterLinkageAverage: Uses average distance pairs. Complete: Uses maximum distance pairs. Single: Uses minimum distance pairs. Ward: Minimizes within-cluster variance. nCaseClustersNumber clusters create k-means clustering. showCaseDendrogramDisplay hierarchical clustering dendrogram cases. showCaseClusterHeatmapDisplay similarity matrix heatmap cluster boundaries. showCaseClusterGuideShow educational guide case clustering analysis. results object containing:

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidation
text: Simplified AI model validation tool comparing diagnostic performance. Calculates AUC, sensitivity, specificity predictor variables performs statistical comparison using DeLong test.

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidation
code: aivalidation(   data,   predictorVars,   outcomeVar,   positiveLevel,   compareModels = FALSE,   youdensJ = FALSE,   matthewsCC = FALSE,   bootstrapCI = FALSE,   nBootstrap = 1000,   rocPlot = FALSE,   crossValidation = "none",   stratified = TRUE,   randomSeed = 42,   showExplanations = FALSE,   showSummaries = FALSE )

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidation
text: data data data frame predictorVars vector strings naming predictor variables (AI scores, human scores, biomarkers, etc.) data. Limited first 5 pairwise comparisons. outcomeVar string naming binary outcome variable (gold standard) data positiveLevel level outcome variable represents positive case compareModels perform statistical comparison models using DeLong test AUC comparison youdensJ calculate display Youden's J statistic (Sensitivity + Specificity - 1) matthewsCC calculate display Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) bootstrapCI use bootstrap resampling confidence intervals (robust small samples) nBootstrap number bootstrap iterations (higher values accurate slower) rocPlot generate ROC curves predictor variables crossValidation cross-validation method model validation (simplified avoid resource limits) stratified maintain outcome variable proportions across folds randomSeed random seed reproducible cross-validation results showExplanations show detailed methodology explanations showSummaries show interpretation summaries results

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidationClass
text: Validates AI diagnostic models calculating performance metrics (AUC, sensitivity, specificity), comparing multiple models, assessing generalization cross-validation. simplified architecture avoids resource limit errors providing comprehensive diagnostic performance evaluation essential medical AI validation. Key Features: ROC curve analysis AUC calculation Optimal threshold selection using Youden's J statistic Advanced performance metrics (Matthews CC, Youden's J) Statistical model comparison using DeLong test K-fold cross-validation stratified sampling Bootstrap confidence intervals robust estimation Interactive ROC curve visualization Comprehensive methodology interpretation guidance Statistical Methods: AUC (Area ROC Curve) discrimination assessment DeLong method AUC confidence intervals (default) Bootstrap resampling robust CI estimation DeLong test pairwise AUC comparisons Youden's J statistic optimal threshold selection Matthews Correlation Coefficient balanced performance assessment Cross-Validation: 5-fold 10-fold cross-validation Stratified sampling maintain outcome proportions Mean SD performance metrics across folds Reproducible results seed control Visualization: Multi-predictor ROC curves AUC labels Publication-ready ggplot2 graphics Limited 10 predictors prevent clutter

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidationClass
text: results object aivalidationClass containing: performanceTable: AUC, sensitivity, specificity, optimal threshold, Youden's J, MCC comparisonTable: Pairwise model comparisons DeLong test p-values cvPerformanceTable: Cross-validated performance metrics (mean SD) rocPlot: ROC curves visualization AUC labels methodologyExplanation: HTML explanation statistical methods resultsInterpretation: HTML interpretation clinical context

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidationClass
text: analysis specifically designed validating AI diagnostic models medical contexts. calculates essential performance metrics provides statistical tests comparing multiple diagnostic models (AI vs human, different AI algorithms, etc.). Performance Metrics: AUC: Measures overall discrimination ability (0.5 = random, 1.0 = perfect) Sensitivity: True positive rate (crucial screening tests) Specificity: True negative rate (important confirmatory tests) Optimal Threshold: Determined Youden's J (maximizes sens + spec - 1) Youden's J: Overall performance measure (0-1, higher better) Matthews CC: Balanced metric imbalanced datasets (-1 +1) Model Comparison: DeLong test accounts correlation ROC curves dataset, providing appropriate statistical comparison AUC values. Limited first 5 predictors avoid resource issues. Cross-Validation: Provides robust estimates model generalization training k-1 folds testing remaining fold, repeated k times. Stratified sampling maintains outcome proportions fold, essential imbalanced datasets. Bootstrap Confidence Intervals: robust DeLong method small samples non-normal distributions, requires computation time. Creates multiple resampled datasets derives CIs distribution AUC values.

title: AI Model Validation ‚Äî aivalidationClass
text: DeLong, E. R., DeLong, D. M., & Clarke-Pearson, D. L. (1988). Comparing areas two correlated receiver operating characteristic curves: nonparametric approach. Biometrics, 44(3), 837-845. Youden, W. J. (1950). Index rating diagnostic tests. Cancer, 3(1), 32-35. Matthews, B. W. (1975). Comparison predicted observed secondary structure T4 phage lysozyme. Biochimica et Biophysica Acta (BBA)-Protein Structure, 405(2), 442-451.

Default 'first_variable'. fillGgalluvial string naming variable data used color flows ggalluvial plot. bin Display labels bin categories. Note: controls label text , binning method. easyalluvial uses internal binning algorithm. custom binning, create categorized variables analysis. orient Orientation plot. Default 'vertical'. usetitle Use custom title plot. mytitle Title plot. maxvars Maximum number variables include alluvial plot. custombinlabels Custom labels bins, separated commas (e.g., "Low,Medium,High"). Leave empty use bin option defaults. colorPalette Color palette diagram flows. showCounts Display count values nodes. themeStyle Theme style plot background elements. enhancedGradients Apply sophisticated color gradients flow edges better visual appeal. plotSubtitle Subtitle plot (shown title). weight Optional weight variable flow thickness. provided, counts used. sankeyStyle Apply Sankey diagram styling (narrow nodes, sigmoid curves). curveType Curve style flows. Requires ggalluvial engine. flowDirection Direction flow diagram. engine Choose plotting engine: easyalluvial automatic plots, ggalluvial manual control curve types Sankey styling. labelNodes Show node labels (ggalluvial engine).

title: Batch Effect Control & Quality Assessment ‚Äî batcheffect
text: Advanced batch effect detection correction tabular data analysis. Essential digital pathology multi-institutional studies technical variation can confound biological signals ("garbage , garbage ").

title: Batch Effect Control & Quality Assessment ‚Äî batcheffect
code: batcheffect(   data,   features,   batch_var,   biological_var,   perform_pca = TRUE,   perform_combat = TRUE,   feature_quality = TRUE,   redundancy_analysis = TRUE,   variance_threshold = 0.01,   correlation_threshold = 0.95,   outlier_method = "robust",   outlier_threshold = 3,   pca_components = 3,   missing_threshold = 20,   show_plots = TRUE,   combat_parametric = TRUE,   save_corrected = FALSE )

title: Batch Effect Control & Quality Assessment ‚Äî batcheffect
text: data data data frame features Numeric feature variables assess batch effects (e.g., biomarkers, image features) batch_var Categorical variable indicating batch/technical groups (e.g., institution, date, instrument) biological_var Optional biological grouping variable preserve batch correction perform_pca Perform Principal Component Analysis visualize batch effects perform_combat Apply ComBat correction remove batch effects preserving biological variation feature_quality Assess individual feature quality including distribution analysis outlier detection redundancy_analysis Analyze feature redundancy correlation structure variance_threshold Threshold removing low-variance features (0 = filtering) correlation_threshold Threshold identifying highly correlated redundant features outlier_method Method outlier detection feature quality assessment outlier_threshold Threshold outlier detection (standard deviations IQR multiplier) pca_components Number principal components compute visualize missing_threshold Maximum percentage missing values allowed per feature show_plots Generate diagnostic plots including PCA plots quality assessments combat_parametric Use parametric ComBat (faster) vs non-parametric (robust) save_corrected Add ComBat-corrected features dataset

what: Brier Score & Integrated Brier Score ‚Äî brierscore
title: Brier Score & Integrated Brier Score ‚Äî brierscore
text: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT LIMITATIONS: BASIC implementation single time-point Brier score evaluation. requires PRE-COMPUTED survival probabilities (raw Cox models). Many features listed IMPLEMENTED STATISTICALLY INVALID. Brier Score analysis evaluates calibration accuracy measuring mean squared difference predicted survival probabilities observed outcomes SINGLE specified time point. Lower Brier scores indicate better prediction accuracy (perfect prediction = 0, worst = 1). Includes scaled Brier scores relative null model (Kaplan-Meier curve). ‚ö†Ô∏è SUPPORTED: Multiple time points, Integrated Brier Score (IBS), competing risks, linear predictor inputs, formula inputs, temporal/external validation flags. features may appear UI generate errors used. rigorous clinical validation, use established packages: riskRegression::Score() pec::pec(). implementation validated standards.

title: Brier Score & Integrated Brier Score ‚Äî brierscore
code: brierscore(   data,   time,   event,   event_code,   predicted_survival,   linear_predictor,   prediction_formula = "",   prediction_time = 60,   multiple_time_points = FALSE,   time_points = "12, 36, 60",   calculate_ibs = FALSE,   ibs_start_time = 0,   ibs_end_time = 60,   scaled_brier = TRUE,   reference_model = FALSE,   reference_predictions,   reference_formula = "",   confidence_intervals = FALSE,   ci_method = "bootstrap",   bootstrap_samples = 500,   confidence_level = 0.95,   compare_multiple_models = FALSE,   additional_predictions,   model_names = "Model 1, Model 2, Model 3",   competing_risks = FALSE,   cause_specific = TRUE,   plot_brier_over_time = TRUE,   plot_calibration_curve = FALSE,   calibration_groups = 10,   plot_model_comparison = FALSE,   plot_integrated_brier = FALSE,   stratified_brier = FALSE,   stratify_by,   inverse_probability_weighting = TRUE,   external_validation = FALSE,   temporal_validation = FALSE,   development_period = "",   missing_handling = "complete",   random_seed = 123 )

title: Brier Score & Integrated Brier Score ‚Äî brierscore
text: data data data frame. time Time--event censoring variable. survival analysis, follow-time days, months, years. event Binary event indicator variable (1 = event occurred, 0 = censored). competing risks, can multi-level factor. event_code level event variable represents event interest (e.g., death, progression, recurrence). predicted_survival Pre-computed survival probabilities specified prediction time. 0 1. example, predicted 5-year survival probability Cox model machine learning algorithm. linear_predictor Linear predictor Cox model (log hazard ratio). provided instead predicted_survival, survival probabilities computed using Breslow estimator baseline hazard. prediction_formula Formula prediction model neither predicted_survival linear_predictor provided. Example: "~ age + stage + grade". Cox model fitted internally predictions generated. prediction_time Time point evaluate Brier score (units time variable). example, 60 months 5-year predictions, 1825 days 5-year predictions days. multiple_time_points Calculate Brier scores multiple time points show calibration changes time. time_points Comma-separated list additional time points evaluation. Example: "12, 24, 36, 60" 1, 2, 3, 5 years (months). calculate_ibs Calculate Integrated Brier Score integrating time-dependent Brier score across follow-period. Provides single summary measure overall prediction performance across time. Computationally expensive. ibs_start_time Start time IBS integration. Usually 0 include entire follow-period. ibs_end_time End time IBS integration. exceed maximum follow-time. Determines time horizon prediction performance summarized. scaled_brier Calculate scaled (standardized) Brier score relative null model (Kaplan-Meier survival curve). Scaled Brier = 1 - (Brier_model / Brier_null). Values near 0 indicate improvement KM, positive values indicate better predictions KM. reference_model Compare Brier score reference prediction model assess incremental value new predictors. reference_predictions Pre-computed survival probabilities reference model comparison. reference_formula Formula reference model reference_predictions provided. Example: "~ age + stage" (simpler full model). confidence_intervals Calculate confidence intervals Brier scores using bootstrap influence function methods. Bootstrap method computationally expensive. ci_method Method confidence interval estimation. Bootstrap accurate computationally intensive, influence function faster. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples confidence interval estimation. samples provide stable estimates. confidence_level Confidence level interval estimation. compare_multiple_models Compare Brier scores across multiple prediction models identify best calibrated model. additional_predictions Additional prediction variables (survival probabilities) competing models comparison. model_names Comma-separated names prediction models compared. Used labeling output tables plots. competing_risks Use competing risks framework multiple event types can occur. Brier score accounts cumulative incidence rather survival. cause_specific competing risks, calculate cause-specific Brier score event interest. plot_brier_over_time Plot time-dependent Brier score across follow-period. Shows prediction accuracy changes time. plot_calibration_curve Display calibration curve showing agreement predicted observed survival probabilities. Perfect calibration appears 45¬∞ line. calibration_groups Number risk groups calibration curve (e.g., deciles = 10). groups provide finer resolution require larger sample size. plot_model_comparison Bar plot comparing Brier scores across multiple models confidence intervals. plot_integrated_brier Visualize IBS area Brier score curve time. stratified_brier Calculate Brier scores stratified important subgroups assess calibration consistency across populations. stratify_by Variable stratified analysis (e.g., treatment arm, age group, center). inverse_probability_weighting Use inverse probability censoring weighting (IPCW) handle censored observations. Recommended proper Brier score estimation. external_validation Indicate external validation (model developed different dataset). Affects interpretation may trigger additional diagnostics. temporal_validation Indicate temporal validation (recent patients development cohort). May assess calibration drift time. development_period End date development period temporal validation assessment (format: YYYY-MM-DD). missing_handling Method handling missing predictor outcome data. random_seed Random seed bootstrap sampling stochastic procedures.

text: data frame 8 rows 7 variables: prevalence Disease prevalence (0.05 0.90) sensitivity Target sensitivity value specificity Target specificity value ci_width Desired 95\ n_sens_expectedExpected sample size sensitivity (Bujang Table 2) n_spec_expectedExpected sample size specificity (Bujang Table 2) n_total_expectedExpected total sample size (maximum sens/spec) Bujang MA (2023). Elaboration Sample Size Planning Performing One-Sample Sensitivity Specificity Analysis Basing Calculations Specified 95\ Table 2 (pages 5-6). doi:10.3390/diagnostics13081390  bujang_table2_validation   Validation dataset containing excerpts Bujang MA (2023) Table 2 diagnostic test sample size calculations. Used validate Clopper-Pearson exact binomial confidence interval implementation.   dataset provides benchmark values validating Clopper-Pearson sample size calculation implementation. row represents specific combination prevalence, target sensitivity/specificity, desired confidence interval width, expected sample sizes published Bujang (2023).Validation Test Cases: Prevalence 5\ Prevalence 5\ Prevalence 10\ Prevalence 10\ Prevalence 20\ Prevalence 50\ Prevalence 50\ Prevalence 90\ # Load validation data data(bujang_table2_validation)# View test cases print(bujang_table2_validation)# Test case: Low prevalence (5%), high targets (95%), narrow CI (0.10) test1 <- bujang_table2_validation[1, ] cat("Prevalence:", test1$prevalence * 100, "%") cat("Targets: Sens =", test1$sensitivity, ", Spec =", test1$specificity, "") cat("Expected total N:", test1$n_total_expected, "")# Compare low vs. high prevalence scenarios low_prev <- bujang_table2_validation[bujang_table2_validation$prevalence == 0.05, ] high_prev <- bujang_table2_validation[bujang_table2_validation$prevalence == 0.90, ]cat(" prevalence (5%) scenarios:") print(low_prev[, c("sensitivity", "specificity", "ci_width", "n_total_expected")])cat(" prevalence (90%) scenarios:") print(high_prev[, c("sensitivity", "specificity", "ci_width", "n_total_expected")]) datasets

code: categorize(   data,   var,   method = "quantile",   nbins = 4,   breaks = "",   sdmult = 1,   labels = "auto",   customlabels = "",   newvarname = "",   includelowest = TRUE,   rightclosed = TRUE,   ordered = TRUE,   excl = TRUE,   showcode = TRUE,   showplot = TRUE )

title: Categorize Continuous Variables ‚Äî categorize
text: data data data frame. var numeric variable categorized bins. method Method creating bins. Options 'equal' equal-width intervals, 'quantile' quantile-based bins, 'manual' custom break points, 'meansd' mean +/- standard deviation bins, 'median' median split, 'jenks' natural breaks clustering. nbins Number categories create (2-20). Used equal, quantile, jenks methods. breaks Comma-separated break points manual binning (e.g., "0, 25, 50, 75, 100"). Values ascending order. sdmult Multiplier standard deviation using meansd method (default = 1). labels label resulting categories. customlabels Comma-separated custom labels (e.g., "Low, Medium, High"). Must match number categories. newvarname Name new categorized variable. Leave empty automatic naming. includelowest TRUE, first interval left-closed (include.lowest cut). rightclosed TRUE, intervals right-closed (left-open). FALSE, left-closed (right-open). ordered TRUE, creates ordered factor preserve category ordering. excl Exclude missing values analysis. showcode Display R code reproduce categorization. showplot Display histogram/density plot showing original distribution cut points.

text: Implements cause-specific hazards modeling competing risks analysis. approach models hazard specific cause separately, treating causes censoring events. Provides comprehensive analysis including hazard ratios, cumulative incidence functions, model comparisons across different causes failure.

title: Single Variable Quality Check ‚Äî checkdata
text: data . var . showOutliers Detect display potential outliers using z-score method (|z| > 3). showDistribution Display descriptive statistics distribution characteristics. showDuplicates Identify count duplicate values dataset. showPatterns Analyze patterns missing data value distributions. rareCategoryThreshold Percentage threshold flagging rare categories (important chi-squared assumptions modeling). clinicalValidation Perform context-specific validation clinical variables (age, lab values, etc.). Heuristic ranges may need adjustment. unitSystem Unit system clinical plausibility checks. Auto-detect attempts infer data ranges. outlierTransform Apply transformation outlier detection handle skewed distributions (especially right-skewed lab values). mcarTest Perform Little's MCAR test available (requires naniar package). Provides formal test vs. heuristic assessment. cvMinMean Suppress coefficient variation absolute mean threshold (avoids instability). showSummary Display plain-language summary data quality suitable copying reports. showAbout Display information data quality assessment methodology. showCaveats Display important limitations assumptions quality assessment.

title: Chi-Square Post-Hoc Tests ‚Äî chisqposttest
text: Performs Chi-Square test post-hoc pairwise comparisons. Post-hoc pairwise comparisons performed overall chi-square test significant (p < alpha). enforces proper statistical workflow prevents data dredging. Selecting 'None' post-hoc method DISABLES pairwise testing. want unadjusted pairwise comparisons, feature available (design, encourage inappropriate multiple testing). automated validation established packages exists. Use caution clinical decision-making.

title: Chi-Square Post-Hoc Tests ‚Äî chisqposttest
code: chisqposttest(   data,   rows,   cols,   counts = NULL,   posthoc = "bonferroni",   sig = 0.05,   excl = FALSE,   exp = FALSE,   plot = FALSE,   showResiduals = FALSE,   showEducational = FALSE,   showDetailedTables = FALSE,   residualsCutoff = 2,   phiCI = FALSE,   testSelection = "auto",   exportResults = FALSE,   showClinicalSummary = FALSE,   copyReadySentences = FALSE,   showAssumptionsCheck = FALSE,   showGlossary = FALSE )

title: Chi-Square Post-Hoc Tests ‚Äî chisqposttest
text: data data data frame. rows variable rows cols variable columns counts Frequency/weight variable contingency table data. specified, data treated already summarized counts per combination. posthoc Method p-value adjustment post-hoc tests. IMPORTANT: Selecting 'None' DISABLES pairwise comparisons entirely (just adjustment). Unadjusted pairwise testing supported prevent inappropriate multiple testing. Choose Bonferroni (conservative), Holm (less conservative), FDR (controls false discovery rate) pairwise testing. sig alpha level significance testing excl exclude missing values analysis exp show expected values table plot display plot standardized residuals showResiduals display standardized residuals analysis interpretation showEducational display educational guidance explanations showDetailedTables display individual 2x2 tables pairwise comparison residualsCutoff critical value identifying significant residuals (typically 2.0 3.0) phiCI calculate bootstrap confidence intervals Phi coefficient using BCa method (Bias-Corrected accelerated). Note: computationally intensive may take longer large tables. testSelection method selecting statistical test pairwise comparisons exportResults Export comprehensive analysis results downloadable format analysis showClinicalSummary Display natural-language summary results clinical interpretation copyReadySentences Generate copy-ready sentences clinical reports showAssumptionsCheck Display validation chi-square test assumptions showGlossary Display glossary statistical terms clinical interpretations

title: Test Dataset for Chi-Square Post-Hoc Analysis ‚Äî chisqposttest_test_data
text: data frame 300 observations 14 variables: PatientID Patient identifier (1-300) Treatment Treatment group: "Standard", "Experimental" Response Treatment response: "Response", "Response" (strongly associated Treatment) Sex Patient sex: "Male", "Female" (balanced) TumorGrade Tumor grade: "Grade 1", "Grade 2", "Grade 3" TumorStage Tumor stage: "Stage ", "Stage II", "Stage III" (moderately associated TumorGrade) Institution Hospital: "Hospital ", "Hospital B", "Hospital C", "Hospital D" QualityScore Quality rating: "High", "Low" (weakly associated Institution) RandomVar1 Random variable: "Group ", "Group B", "Group C" (associations) RandomVar2 Random variable: "Type X", "Type Y" (associations) RareCategory Frequency category: "Common", "Uncommon", "Rare" (unbalanced) BinaryOutcome Binary outcome: "Negative", "Positive" (associated RareCategory) AgeGroup Age category: "Young", "Middle", "Elderly" BiomarkerStatus Biomarker status: "Negative", "Positive" (moderately associated AgeGroup)

title: Test Dataset for Chi-Square Post-Hoc Analysis ‚Äî chisqposttest_test_data
text: dataset contains several types associations designed test different aspects chi-square post-hoc analysis: Strong Associations: Treatment -> Response: Clear treatment effect odds ratio ~5 Moderate Associations: TumorGrade -> TumorStage: Higher grades associated advanced stages AgeGroup -> BiomarkerStatus: Age-related biomarker expression pattern Weak Associations: Institution -> QualityScore: Institutional quality differences RareCategory -> BinaryOutcome: Effect rare category small cell counts Associations: RandomVar1 ‚ä• RandomVar2: Independent random variables null hypothesis testing dataset includes approximately 5% missing data Treatment, Sex, TumorGrade variables test missing data handling options.

title: Test Dataset for Chi-Square Post-Hoc Analysis ‚Äî chisqposttest_test_data
text: Simulated data created testing purposes. Associations based realistic clinical scenarios data artificially generated.

title: Classical Survival Power Analysis (Intermediate) ‚Äî classicalSurvivalPower
text: data data data frame (optional power calculations). calculation_type Type power calculation perform. method Method power/sample size calculation. hazard_control Event hazard rate control group (events per person-time unit). hazard_treatment Event hazard rate treatment group (events per person-time unit). hazard_ratio Hazard ratio (treatment/control) Schoenfeld method. study_duration Maximum study duration (months years). accrual_duration Patient accrual (recruitment) duration. dropout_rate Equal dropout hazard rate groups. allocation_ratio Randomization ratio (treatment:control). alpha Type error rate (significance level). beta Type II error rate (1 - power). power Statistical power (1 - beta). sided One-sided two-sided statistical test. entry_type Pattern patient entry study. gamma Rate parameter exponential entry (0 uniform entry). sample_size_input Total sample size calculating power. events_input Number events calculating power Schoenfeld method. show_summary Whether display comprehensive study design summary. show_formulas Whether display mathematical formulas used. show_interpretation Whether include clinical interpretation results. show_power_plot Whether display power curve visualization. show_timeline_plot Whether display study timeline visualization Lachin-Foulkes method. power_plot_range Sample size range power plots (format 'min,max' 'auto'). export_results Whether export detailed results external analysis. export_power_curve Whether export power curve data points.

what: Survival Analysis Power & Sample Size ‚Äî classicalSurvivalPowerClass
title: Survival Analysis Power & Sample Size ‚Äî classicalSurvivalPowerClass
text: Power analysis sample size calculation survival studies using Lachin-Foulkes Schoenfeld methods gsDesign package. module provides comprehensive power calculations clinical trials time--event endpoints.

title: Survival Analysis Power & Sample Size ‚Äî classicalSurvivalPowerClass
text: Power analysis results sample size, number events, study design parameters.

title: Survival Analysis Power & Sample Size ‚Äî classicalSurvivalPowerClass
text: module implements functionality requested GitHub Issue #72, providing comprehensive power analysis capabilities survival studies. Two main methods supported: Lachin-Foulkes Method: Full study design approach Accounts accrual duration, follow-period, dropout rates Supports uniform exponential patient entry patterns Provides sample size number events Schoenfeld Method: Events-based approximation Based asymptotic normal distribution log-rank statistic Simpler calculations focused number events Useful quick estimates design comparisons

text: data . dep . indep . testSize . noOfFolds . testing . reporting . classifier . minSplit . complexity . maxCompete . maxSurrogate . maxDepth . noOfTrees . maxDepthRandFor . sampleFraction . splitRule . knnNeighbors Number nearest neighbors KNN classification. knnDistance . svmKernel . svmCost Regularization parameter SVM. svmGamma Kernel coefficient SVM (used RBF, polynomial, sigmoid kernels). plotDecisionTree . predictedFreq . printRandForest . predictedFreqRF . balancingMethod Method handling class imbalance medical datasets. validateMethod Validation method clinical model assessment. bootstrapSamples Number bootstrap samples confidence intervals. reportClinicalMetrics Report sensitivity, specificity, PPV, NPV, likelihood ratios. reportConfidenceIntervals Include 95\ clinical metrics. reportMCC Calculate Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC), balanced metric imbalanced datasets. MCC ranges -1 (perfect disagreement) +1 (perfect agreement), 0 indicating random prediction. positiveClass Specify class considered "positive" clinical metrics (sensitivity, specificity, PPV, NPV, likelihood ratios). left empty, second factor level used positive. critical ensuring correct interpretation diagnostic performance metrics. seed Set random seed reproducibility. Using seed produce identical results across runs, critical validating analyses. thresholdMethod Method determining classification threshold binary outcomes. Youden J maximizes sensitivity + specificity. Manual allows custom cutoff. thresholdValue Custom probability threshold using manual threshold method. used Decision Threshold Method set Manual Cutoff. showSummary Display plain-language summary classification results suitable copying clinical reports. showAbout Display information classification methodology interpretation guidance. showGlossary Display glossary machine learning clinical metrics terms.

title: Clinical Trial CONSORT Flow Data ‚Äî clinical_trial_consort_data
text: data frame 500 rows 17 columns: participant_id Unique participant identifier (PT-0001 PT-0500) age Age years (mean=62, sd=12) sex Sex (Male/Female) age_exclusion Screening exclusion reason: age criteria violations performance_exclusion Screening exclusion reason: ECOG performance status organ function issues comorbidity_exclusion Screening exclusion reason: severe comorbidity prior malignancy consent_exclusion Enrollment exclusion reason: consent-related issues eligibility_exclusion Enrollment exclusion reason: eligibility re-assessment failures treatment_arm Randomized treatment assignment (Treatment /Treatment B) allocation_exclusion Post-randomization exclusion: intervention received followup_loss Follow-exclusion reason: lost follow-moved followup_death Follow-exclusion reason: death withdrawal analysis_exclusion Analysis exclusion reason: missing data protocol violations outcome_response Treatment outcome (Complete/Partial Response, Stable/Progressive Disease)

title: Clinical Trial CONSORT Flow Data ‚Äî clinical_trial_consort_data

title: Clinical Trial CONSORT Flow Data ‚Äî clinical_trial_consort_data
text: dataset simulates realistic Phase III clinical trial : 500 participants initially assessed eligibility 20\ 10\ 1:1 randomization Treatment vs Treatment B 5\ 12\ 3\ Final retention: 58.4\ Exclusion variables use NA participants continued next stage. Non-NA values indicate specific exclusion reason stage.

title: Clinical Trial CONSORT Flow Data ‚Äî clinical_trial_consort_data
text: dataset demonstrates features consortdiagram function: Multiple exclusion stages (screening, enrollment, allocation, follow-, analysis) Multiple exclusion reasons per stage Randomized treatment arms Realistic retention rates Detailed exclusion reasons CONSORT compliance

title: Clinical Trial CONSORT Flow Data ‚Äî clinical_trial_consort_data
text: Schulz KF, Altman DG, Moher D. (2010). CONSORT 2010 Statement: updated guidelines reporting parallel group randomised trials. BMJ, 340:c332. Ots R. (2024). CONSORT diagrams R using patient-level data. https://www.riinu./2024/02/consort/

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: Advanced heatmap visualization clinical biomedical data using tidyheatmaps package. function creates publication-ready heatmaps tidy data support clinical annotations, multiple scaling methods, comprehensive customization options. Perfect visualizing biomarker expression patterns, treatment responses, genomic data, quality control metrics.

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: jamovi analysis object containing clinical heatmap supporting information

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: Clinical Heatmap module leverages powerful tidyheatmaps package create sophisticated visualizations multivariate clinical data. supports various data types use cases: Supported Data Types: Biomarker Expression: IHC scores, molecular markers, protein levels Genomic Data: Gene expression, mutation status, copy number variations Clinical Metrics: Laboratory values, vital signs, diagnostic scores Quality Control: Batch effects, instrument performance, reproducibility Treatment Response: Longitudinal measurements, dose-response relationships Key Features: Tidy Data Integration: Works directly long-format clinical datasets Clinical Annotations: Row column annotations patient/biomarker characteristics Flexible Scaling: Row, column, bidirectional Z-score normalization Hierarchical Clustering: Automatic pattern discovery customizable clustering Color Palettes: Clinical-friendly color schemes including colorblind-safe options Missing Data Handling: Multiple strategies incomplete clinical datasets Export Options: Publication-ready outputs customizable dimensions

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: Biomarker Profiling: Visualize multi-marker expression panels across patient cohorts Precision Medicine: Display genomic alterations therapeutic targets Quality Assurance: Monitor laboratory performance batch effects Clinical Trials: Show treatment response patterns dose relationships Diagnostic Patterns: Reveal disease subtypes molecular classifications

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: function expects data "tidy" (long) format three essential variables: Row Variable: Defines heatmap rows (e.g., patient IDs, gene names) Column Variable: Defines heatmap columns (e.g., biomarkers, time points) Value Variable: Numeric values visualize (e.g., expression levels, scores)

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: None: Raw values displayed without transformation Row: Z-score normalization within row (standardizes across columns) Column: Z-score normalization within column (standardizes across rows) : Global Z-score normalization across entire dataset

title: Clinical Heatmap with tidyheatmaps ‚Äî clinicalheatmapClass
text: Exclude: Remove rows/columns missing values (complete cases ) Mean: Replace missing values column/row means Median: Replace missing values column/row medians (robust outliers) Zero: Replace missing values zero (appropriate clinical scales)
