title: Missing Data Analysis and Imputation ‚Äî missingdata
text: Comprehensive missing data analysis multiple imputation using mice ggmice packages. Analyze missing data patterns, perform multiple imputation chained equations (MICE), visualize imputation results. Includes diagnostic plots convergence assessment, comparison observed vs imputed data, quality evaluation. Perfect clinical research data preprocessing missing data common proper handling critical valid statistical inference.

title: Missing Data Analysis and Imputation ‚Äî missingdata
text: data data data frame. analysis_vars Variables include missing data analysis imputation. Can include numeric, factor, ID variables. analysis_type Type missing data analysis perform. Pattern analysis explores missing data structure, imputation performs MICE, complete . n_imputations Number imputed datasets generate using MICE algorithm. Typically 5-20 imputations sufficient applications. max_iterations Maximum number MICE iterations per imputation. Default 5, increase convergence issues occur. imputation_method Default imputation method. Auto-select chooses appropriate methods based variable types. PMM robust continuous variables. seed_value Random seed reproducible imputation results. convergence_check Perform convergence diagnostics ensure MICE algorithm stability. show_pattern_plot Display visual representation missing data patterns. show_pattern_table Display tabular summary missing data patterns. show_correlation_plot Display correlation matrix incomplete variables. show_flux_plot Display influx outflux missing data patterns. show_trace_plot Display convergence trace plots imputation diagnostics. show_density_plot Compare distributions observed vs imputed data. show_stripplot Display strip plots comparing observed imputed values. show_scatterplot Display scatter plots observed vs imputed data relationships. show_imputation_summary Display summary statistics information imputation process. show_interpretation Display guidance missing data analysis imputation best practices clinical research.

title: Mixed-Effects Cox Regression ‚Äî mixedcox
text: Performs Cox proportional hazards regression random effects clustered hierarchical survival data. method accounts correlation within clusters (e.g., patients within hospitals, multiple events per patient) using mixed-effects modeling. random effects capture cluster-specific variation estimating population-level  fixed effects.

code: modalitycomparison(   data,   modality1_var,   modality2_var,   case_id = NULL,   modality1_name = "Modality 1",   modality2_name = "Modality 2",   show_discordance_analysis = TRUE,   score_categories = "auto",   show_contingency_table = TRUE,   calculate_weighted_kappa = FALSE,   confidence_intervals = TRUE,   directional_analysis = TRUE,   low_end_focus = FALSE,   show_plots = TRUE )

title: Modality Comparison Analysis ‚Äî modalitycomparison
text: data data data frame paired observations two modalities. modality1_var Variable containing scores/ratings first modality (e.g., glass slides). modality2_var Variable containing scores/ratings second modality (e.g., digital images). case_id Optional case identifier variable tracking individual cases. modality1_name Descriptive name first modality (e.g., "Glass Slides"). modality2_name Descriptive name second modality (e.g., "Digital Images"). show_discordance_analysis Perform detailed analysis discordance patterns modalities. score_categories Category system score interpretation analysis. show_contingency_table Display detailed cross-tabulation scores modalities. calculate_weighted_kappa Calculate weighted kappa ordinal scores (requires ordered categories). confidence_intervals Calculate display 95\ agreement statistics. directional_analysis Analyze systematic bias one direction (e.g., higher scores digital vs glass). low_end_focus Perform specialized analysis focusing agreement low expression levels (relevant HER2-low/null distinction). show_plots Generate scatter plots agreement visualization.

code: modelbuilder(   data,   clinicalPreset = "none",   outcome,   outcomePositive,   splitData = FALSE,   randomSeed = 123,   buildBasicModel = TRUE,   basicPredictors,   basicModelName = "basic_model",   buildEnhancedModel = FALSE,   enhancedPredictors,   enhancedModelName = "enhanced_model",   buildBiomarkerModel = FALSE,   biomarkerPredictors,   biomarkerModelName = "biomarker_model",   buildCustomModel = FALSE,   customPredictors,   customModelName = "custom_model",   includeInteractions = FALSE,   interactionTerms = "",   useStepwise = FALSE,   stepwiseDirection = "both",   selectionCriterion = "aic",   transformVariables = FALSE,   transformMethod = "log",   missingDataMethod = "complete_cases",   imputationSets = 5,   crossValidation = FALSE,   cvFolds = 5,   bootstrapValidation = FALSE,   bootstrapReps = 1000,   showModelSummary = TRUE,   showPerformanceMetrics = TRUE,   showCalibrationPlots = FALSE,   showROCCurves = FALSE,   compareModels = FALSE,   createPredictions = FALSE,   exportForDCA = FALSE,   calculateNRI = FALSE,   nriThresholds = "0.05, 0.10, 0.20",   calculateIDI = FALSE,   penalizedRegression = FALSE,   penaltyType = "lasso",   generateRiskScore = FALSE,   riskScorePoints = "simple" )

title: Prediction Model Builder ‚Äî modelbuilder
text: data data data frame. clinicalPreset Predefined clinical scenarios optimized settings variable recommendations. outcome Binary outcome variable predict (e.g., disease presence, adverse event occurrence). outcomePositive level outcome variable represents positive case. splitData Split data training (70\ unbiased model evaluation. randomSeed Random seed reproducible data splitting results. buildBasicModel Build basic clinical model using demographic primary risk factors. basicPredictors Variables basic clinical model (e.g., age, sex, primary risk factors). basicModelName Name basic model (used column name predictions). buildEnhancedModel Build enhanced model additional clinical variables. enhancedPredictors Variables enhanced model (include basic predictors plus additional ones). enhancedModelName Name enhanced model (used column name predictions). buildBiomarkerModel Build model incorporating biomarkers advanced diagnostics. biomarkerPredictors Variables biomarker model (clinical variables plus biomarkers). biomarkerModelName Name biomarker model (used column name predictions). buildCustomModel Build custom model user-specified variables. customPredictors Variables custom model. customModelName Name custom model (used column name predictions). includeInteractions Include two-way interactions predictor variables. interactionTerms Specify interactions (e.g., "agesex, diabetessmoking"). Leave empty pairwise. useStepwise Use stepwise variable selection optimize models. stepwiseDirection Direction stepwise variable selection. selectionCriterion Criterion stepwise variable selection. transformVariables Apply automatic transformations continuous variables. transformMethod Type transformation apply continuous variables. missingDataMethod Method handling missing data predictor variables. imputationSets Number imputation sets multiple imputation. crossValidation Perform k-fold cross-validation robust model assessment. cvFolds Number folds cross-validation. bootstrapValidation Perform bootstrap validation assess optimism shrinkage. bootstrapReps Number bootstrap replications validation. showModelSummary Display regression coefficients model statistics. showPerformanceMetrics Display AUC, calibration, performance measures. showCalibrationPlots Display calibration plots model. showROCCurves Display ROC curves discrimination assessment. compareModels Display side--side comparison models. createPredictions Add predicted probability columns dataset DCA use. exportForDCA Format output specifically use Decision Curve Analysis module. calculateNRI Calculate NRI comparing enhanced models basic model. nriThresholds Risk thresholds NRI calculation (comma-separated). calculateIDI Calculate IDI comparing models. penalizedRegression Use penalized regression (LASSO/Ridge) variable selection. penaltyType Type penalty regularized regression. generateRiskScore Create integer risk score best model clinical use. riskScorePoints Method creating clinical risk score.

title: Multivariable Survival Analysis ‚Äî multisurvival
text: Performs multivariable survival analysis using Cox proportional hazards regression. multivariable survival analysis, person-time follow-crucial properly adjusting covariates accounting varying observation periods. Cox proportional hazards model incorporates person-time modeling hazard function, represents instantaneous event rate per unit person-time. stratifying analyses examining multiple predictors, model accounts factors influence event rates relative person-time risk subgroup.

title: Multivariable Survival Analysis ‚Äî multisurvival
code: multisurvival(   data,   elapsedtime = NULL,   tint = FALSE,   dxdate = NULL,   fudate = NULL,   timetypedata = "ymd",   timetypeoutput = "months",   uselandmark = FALSE,   landmark = 3,   outcome = NULL,   outcomeLevel,   dod,   dooc,   awd,   awod,   analysistype = "overall",   explanatory = NULL,   contexpl = NULL,   multievent = FALSE,   hr = FALSE,   sty = "t1",   ph_cox = FALSE,   km = FALSE,   endplot = 60,   byplot = 12,   ci95 = FALSE,   risktable = FALSE,   censored = FALSE,   medianline = "none",   pplot = FALSE,   cutp = "12, 36, 60",   calculateRiskScore = FALSE,   numRiskGroups = "four",   plotRiskGroups = FALSE,   ac = FALSE,   adjexplanatory = NULL,   ac_method = "average",   showNomogram = FALSE,   use_stratify = FALSE,   stratvar = NULL,   person_time = FALSE,   time_intervals = "12, 36, 60",   rate_multiplier = 100,   showExplanations = FALSE,   showSummaries = TRUE )

title: Multivariable Survival Analysis ‚Äî multisurvival
text: data dataset analyzed, provided data frame. Must contain variables specified options . elapsedtime numeric variable representing follow-time event last observation. tint = false, pre-calculated numeric time variable. tint = true, dxdate fudate used calculate time. tint true, survival time calculated dxdate fudate. false, elapsedtime provided pre-calculated numeric variable. dxdate Date diagnosis. Required tint = true. Accepts: (1) Date/datetime text, (2) Numeric Unix epoch seconds (DateTime Converter's corrected_datetime_numeric output), (3) Numeric datetime values R. Time intervals calculated difference follow-date. fudate Follow-date date last observation. Required tint = true. Accepts: (1) Date/datetime text, (2) Numeric Unix epoch seconds (DateTime Converter's corrected_datetime_numeric output), (3) Numeric datetime values R. Must format diagnosis date. timetypedata Specifies format date variables input data. critical tint = true, dxdate fudate parsed according format calculate survival time. example, data files record dates "YYYY-MM-DD", select ymd. timetypeoutput units survival time reported output. Choose days, weeks, months, years. uselandmark true, applies landmark analysis starting specified time point. landmark time point (units defined timetypeoutput) start landmark analyses. used uselandmark = true. outcome outcome variable. Typically indicates event status (e.g., death, recurrence). survival analysis, may factor numeric event indicator. outcomeLevel level outcome considered event. example, outcome factor, specify level indicates event occurrence. dod level outcome corresponding death due disease, applicable. dooc level outcome corresponding death due causes, applicable. awd level outcome corresponding alive disease, applicable. awod level outcome corresponding alive without disease, applicable. analysistype Type survival analysis: - overall: -cause survival - cause: Cause-specific survival - compete: Competing risks analysis explanatory Categorical explanatory (predictor) variables included Cox model. contexpl Continuous explanatory (predictor) variables included Cox model. multievent true, multiple event levels considered competing risks analysis. Requires specifying dod, dooc, etc. hr true, generates plot hazard ratios explanatory variable Cox model. sty style hazard ratio (forest) plot. "finalfit" "survminer forestplot". ph_cox true, tests proportional hazards assumption Cox model. Use suspect violations PH assumption. km true, produces Kaplan-Meier survival plot. Useful visualization survival functions without covariate adjustment. endplot maximum follow-time (units defined timetypeoutput) display survival plots. byplot interval (units defined timetypeoutput) time points labels shown plots. ci95 true, displays 95\ estimates plots. risktable true, displays number subjects risk time point survival plot. censored true, marks censored observations (e.g., using tick marks) survival plot. medianline true, displays line indicating median survival time survival plot. pplot true, displays p-value survival comparison test survival plot. cutp . calculateRiskScore true, calculates risk score Cox model coefficients individual. numRiskGroups Select number risk groups create risk scores. data divided equal quantiles based selection. plotRiskGroups true, stratifies individuals risk groups based calculated risk scores plots survival curves. ac . adjexplanatory . ac_method Method computing adjusted survival curves showNomogram . use_stratify true, uses stratification handle variables violate proportional hazards assumption. Stratification creates separate baseline hazard functions different groups. stratvar Variables used stratification. proportional hazards met, stratification can adjust model better fit data allowing different baseline hazards. person_time Enable option calculate display person-time metrics, including total follow-time incidence rates. metrics help quantify rate events per unit time study population. time_intervals Specify time intervals stratified person-time analysis. Enter  comma-separated list time points create intervals. example,  "12, 36, 60" create intervals 0-12, 12-36, 36-60, 60+. rate_multiplier Specify multiplier incidence rates (e.g., 100 rates per 100 person-years, 1000 rates per 1000 person-years). showExplanations Display detailed explanations analysis component help interpret statistical methods results. showSummaries Display natural language summaries alongside tables plots. summaries provide plain-language interpretations statistical results. Recommended clinical users. Turn reduce visual clutter summaries needed.

title: Multivariable Survival Analysis ‚Äî multisurvival
code: # Example 1: Basic multivariable Cox regression library(survival) data(colon)  multisurvival(     data = colon,     elapsedtime = "time",     outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1",     explanatory = c("sex", "obstruct", "perfor"),     contexpl = c("age", "nodes"),     timetypeoutput = "days",     hr = TRUE  # Show hazard ratio plot ) #> Error in multisurvival(data = colon, elapsedtime = "time", outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1", explanatory = c("sex", "obstruct", "perfor"),     contexpl = c("age", "nodes"), timetypeoutput = "days", hr = TRUE): argument "dod" is missing, with no default  # Example 2: Using dates to calculate survival time # Assuming you have diagnosis and follow-up dates multisurvival(     data = mydata,     tint = TRUE,     dxdate = "diagnosis_date",     fudate = "last_followup_date",     timetypedata = "ymd",     timetypeoutput = "months",     outcome = "vital_status",     outcomeLevel = "Dead",     explanatory = c("stage", "grade"),     contexpl = "age" ) #> Error: object 'mydata' not found  # Example 3: Risk stratification analysis multisurvival(     data = colon,     elapsedtime = "time",     outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1",     explanatory = c("sex", "obstruct"),     contexpl = c("age", "nodes"),     calculateRiskScore = TRUE,     numRiskGroups = "three",     plotRiskGroups = TRUE,     addRiskScore = TRUE,  # Add risk score to data     addRiskGroup = TRUE   # Add risk group to data ) #> Error in multisurvival(data = colon, elapsedtime = "time", outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1", explanatory = c("sex", "obstruct"), contexpl = c("age",         "nodes"), calculateRiskScore = TRUE, numRiskGroups = "three",     plotRiskGroups = TRUE, addRiskScore = TRUE, addRiskGroup = TRUE): unused arguments (addRiskScore = TRUE, addRiskGroup = TRUE)  # Example 4: Model with stratification for non-proportional hazards multisurvival(     data = colon,     elapsedtime = "time",     outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1",     explanatory = c("obstruct", "perfor"),     contexpl = c("age", "nodes"),     use_stratify = TRUE,     stratvar = "sex",  # Stratify by sex if PH assumption violated     ph_cox = TRUE      # Test proportional hazards assumption ) #> Error in multisurvival(data = colon, elapsedtime = "time", outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1", explanatory = c("obstruct", "perfor"),     contexpl = c("age", "nodes"), use_stratify = TRUE, stratvar = "sex",     ph_cox = TRUE): argument "dod" is missing, with no default  # Example 5: Stepwise model selection # multisurvival( #     data = colon, #     elapsedtime = "time", #     outcome = "status", #     outcomeLevel = "1", #     explanatory = c("sex", "obstruct", "perfor", "adhere"), #     contexpl = c("age", "nodes"), #     use_modelSelection = TRUE, #     modelSelection = "both",  # Stepwise selection #     selectionCriteria = "aic", #     pEntry = 0.05, #     pRemoval = 0.10 # )  # Example 6: Person-time analysis multisurvival(     data = colon,     elapsedtime = "time",     outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1",     explanatory = "sex",     contexpl = "age",     person_time = TRUE,     time_intervals = "180, 365, 730",  # 6mo, 1yr, 2yr     rate_multiplier = 1000  # Rate per 1000 person-days ) #> Error in multisurvival(data = colon, elapsedtime = "time", outcome = "status",     outcomeLevel = "1", explanatory = "sex", contexpl = "age",     person_time = TRUE, time_intervals = "180, 365, 730", rate_multiplier = 1000): argument "dod" is missing, with no default

title: Multivariable Survival Analysis Implementation ‚Äî multisurvivalClass
text: Backend implementation class comprehensive multivariable survival analysis. R6 class provides core functionality multisurvival jamovi module, handling Cox proportional hazards regression, risk stratification, machine learning survival methods, advanced survival modeling techniques.

title: Multivariable Survival Analysis Implementation ‚Äî multisurvivalClass

what: Smoothly Clipped Absolute Deviation Cox Regression ‚Äî ncvregcox
title: Smoothly Clipped Absolute Deviation Cox Regression ‚Äî ncvregcox
text: Smoothly Clipped Absolute Deviation (SCAD) Cox regression high-dimensional survival data. SCAD provides automatic variable selection oracle properties, avoiding -penalization large coefficients maintaining sparsity small coefficients. Particularly useful genomics high-dimensional clinical data interpretable variable selection crucial.

title: Analysis Without Gold Standard ‚Äî nogoldstandard
text: Analysis diagnostic tests without gold standard reference using multiple statistical approaches. Implements Latent Class Analysis (Hui & Walter, 1980), Bayesian methods (Joseph et al., 1995),  composite reference standards estimating test performance perfect reference test exists.

title: Analysis Without Gold Standard ‚Äî nogoldstandard
code: # \donttest{ # Basic example with simulated diagnostic test data set.seed(123) n <- 200  # Simulate disease status (latent, unknown) disease <- rbinom(n, 1, 0.3)  # 30\% prevalence  # Simulate test results with known sensitivity/specificity test1_result <- ifelse(disease == 1,                        rbinom(sum(disease), 1, 0.85),     # sensitivity 0.85                        rbinom(sum(1-disease), 1, 0.15))   # 1-specificity 0.15 test1_result <- factor(test1_result, levels=c(0,1), labels=c("Negative", "Positive"))  test2_result <- ifelse(disease == 1,                        rbinom(sum(disease), 1, 0.80),     # sensitivity 0.80                        rbinom(sum(1-disease), 1, 0.10))   # 1-specificity 0.10 test2_result <- factor(test2_result, levels=c(0,1), labels=c("Negative", "Positive"))  # Create data frame test_data <- data.frame(     Test1 = test1_result,     Test2 = test2_result )  # Latent Class Analysis (recommended method) nogoldstandard(     data = test_data,     test1 = "Test1",     test1Positive = "Positive",     test2 = "Test2",     test2Positive = "Positive",     method = "latent_class" ) #> Error in nogoldstandard(data = test_data, test1 = "Test1", test1Positive = "Positive",     test2 = "Test2", test2Positive = "Positive", method = "latent_class"): argument "test3Positive" is missing, with no default  # With bootstrap confidence intervals nogoldstandard(     data = test_data,     test1 = "Test1",     test1Positive = "Positive",     test2 = "Test2",     test2Positive = "Positive",     method = "latent_class",     bootstrap = TRUE,     nboot = 500,     verbose = TRUE ) #> Error in nogoldstandard(data = test_data, test1 = "Test1", test1Positive = "Positive",     test2 = "Test2", test2Positive = "Positive", method = "latent_class",     bootstrap = TRUE, nboot = 500, verbose = TRUE): argument "test3Positive" is missing, with no default # }

title: Fagan Nomogram for Diagnostic Test Analysis ‚Äî nomogrammer
text: Creates Fagan nomograms Bayesian analysis diagnostic testing. Fagan nomogram graphical tool used estimate post-test probabilities pre-test probabilities likelihood ratios. function supports input via sensitivity/specificity directly via likelihood ratios.

title: Fagan Nomogram for Diagnostic Test Analysis ‚Äî nomogrammer
code: nomogrammer(   Prevalence,   Sens = NULL,   Spec = NULL,   Plr = NULL,   Nlr = NULL,   Detail = FALSE,   NullLine = FALSE,   LabelSize = (14/5),   Verbose = FALSE )

title: Fagan Nomogram for Diagnostic Test Analysis ‚Äî nomogrammer
text: Prevalence Prior probability (prevalence) number 0 1. represents probability disease test performed. Sens Model sensitivity number 0 1. probability test positive disease present. Optional Plr/Nlr provided. Spec Model specificity number 0 1. probability test negative disease absent. Optional Plr/Nlr provided. Plr Positive likelihood ratio (calculated Sens Spec provided). Must >= 1. provided along Nlr, takes precedence Sens/Spec. Nlr Negative likelihood ratio (calculated Sens Spec provided). Must 0 1. provided along Plr, takes precedence Sens/Spec. Detail Logical. TRUE, overlays key statistics (prevalence, likelihood ratios, posterior probabilities) onto plot. NullLine Logical. TRUE, adds reference line prior probability LR = 1 illustrate uninformative test. LabelSize Numeric. Controls size text labels plot. Default 14/5 ‚âà 2.8. Verbose Logical. TRUE, prints diagnostic metrics console.

title: Fagan Nomogram for Diagnostic Test Analysis ‚Äî nomogrammer
text: ggplot2 object containing Fagan nomogram. plot shows: Left axis: Prior probability (prevalence) percentages Middle axis: Likelihood ratios Right axis: Posterior probability percentages Red line: Positive test pathway Blue line: Negative test pathway

title: Fagan Nomogram for Diagnostic Test Analysis ‚Äî nomogrammer
text: Fagan nomogram visually represents Bayes' theorem diagnostic testing: $$Post-test odds = Pre-test odds √ó Likelihood ratio$$ function accepts either: Sensitivity Specificity (traditional approach) Positive Negative Likelihood Ratios (direct approach) provided, sensitivity/specificity take precedence warning issued. Mathematical relationships: PLR = Sensitivity / (1 - Specificity) NLR = (1 - Sensitivity) / Specificity calculating LRs: Specificity = (PLR - 1) / (PLR - NLR) calculating LRs: Sensitivity = PLR √ó (1 - Specificity) Post-test probability (+) = (Prevalence √ó PLR) / ((Prevalence √ó PLR) + (1 - Prevalence)) Post-test probability (-) = (Prevalence √ó NLR) / ((Prevalence √ó NLR) + (1 - Prevalence))

title: Non-Parametric Statistical Methods ‚Äî nonparametric
text: Comprehensive non-parametric statistical methods including Kruskal-Wallis test, Friedman test, Mann-Whitney U test, robust alternatives classical procedures. Designed specifically clinical research normality assumptions violated. enhanced module combines distribution-free methods proper effect size calculations, assumption checking, post hoc analysis - addressing critical gaps identified 30\ pathology studies use methods.

title: Non-Parametric Statistical Methods ‚Äî nonparametric
text: data dataset analyzed, provided data frame. deps Multiple continuous variables analyzed. numeric variables representing biomarker expression levels, cell counts, morphometric measurements, quantitative pathology data. outcome Single continuous outcome variable. Use either 'deps' multiple variables. groups Categorical variable defining groups compared. Mann-Whitney U test, exactly 2 levels. Kruskal-Wallis test, can 2+ levels. paired_variable Variable identifying paired observations repeated measures designs. blocking_variable Variable identifying blocks Friedman test designs. test_type Select appropriate non-parametric test based study design. effect_size Calculate appropriate effect sizes non-parametric tests confidence intervals. effect_size_method Method calculating effect sizes appropriate chosen test: - Eta-squared/Epsilon-squared: Kruskal-Wallis (multi-group) - Rank-biserial correlation: Wilcoxon tests (paired data) Cliff's Delta: Mann-Whitney U tests (two independent groups) - CLES/Vargha-Delaney : Probability-based effect sizes - Kendall's W: Friedman test (repeated measures concordance) confidence_intervals Calculate bootstrap confidence intervals effect sizes using BCa method. confidence_level Confidence level confidence intervals descriptive statistics. post_hoc Perform post-hoc pairwise comparisons overall test significant. post_hoc_method Method post hoc pairwise comparisons. p_adjustment Method correcting p-values multiple comparisons. robust_method Method robust rank-based estimation. trim_proportion Proportion observations trim end robust estimation. winsorize_proportion Proportion observations winsorize end. bootstrap_ci Use bootstrap methods confidence interval estimation. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap resamples confidence interval estimation. test_assumptions Perform comprehensive assumption checking non-parametric tests. normality_tests Test normality data justify use non-parametric methods. assumption_checks Perform detailed assumption checks including independence, distribution shape, outlier assessment. homogeneity_test Test homogeneity variance groups. exact_test Use exact distribution calculations instead asymptotic approximations. exact_p_values Use exact p-values computationally feasible. continuity_correction Apply continuity correction better normal approximation. tie_correction Apply correction tied observations rank-based tests. ties_method Method handling tied ranks calculations. show_boxplots Generate box plots visual group comparison. show_violin_plots Generate violin plots showing distribution shapes. show_rank_plots Generate plots showing rank distributions. show_effect_plots Generate visualization effect sizes confidence intervals. descriptive_plots Generate comprehensive set descriptive plots including box plots, violin plots, distribution comparisons. show_qqplots Generate Q-Q plots normality assessment. show_descriptives Display comprehensive descriptive statistics. show_test_statistics Display main non-parametric test results table. show_post_hoc_table Display post-hoc pairwise comparison results. show_effect_sizes Display detailed effect size calculations interpretations. show_assumptions Display assumption testing results implications. show_robust_statistics Display robust statistical estimates using alternative methods. show_power_analysis Perform post-hoc power analysis sample size recommendations. show_instructions Display comprehensive instructions using non-parametric methods. show_explanations Display detailed explanations non-parametric methods assumptions. show_interpretation Provide plain-language interpretation statistical results. show_recommendations Provide recommendations follow-analyses study design. clinical_context Clinical context tailored interpretation recommendations. set_seed Set random seed reproducible bootstrap permutation results. seed_value Specific seed value reproducible random number generation. missing_data_handling Method handling missing data non-parametric analyses. alpha_level Significance level hypothesis testing (default: 0.05). minimum_sample_size Minimum sample size per group showing adequacy warnings. outlier_method Method identifying outliers data. small_sample_exact Automatically use exact methods sample sizes small (n < 20 per group). report_standardized_statistics Report standardized versions test statistics better comparability.

title: Ordinal ROC Analysis ‚Äî ordinalroc
text: Ordinal ROC analysis diagnostic tests predicting ordered categorical outcomes tumor differentiation grade (well/moderate/poor), fibrosis stage (F0-F4), inflammation severity (none/mild/moderate/severe), cancer stage (/II/III/IV). Unlike binary ROC dichotomizes outcomes, ordinal ROC preserves natural ordering categories accounts severity/progression inherent ordinal scales. analysis uses cumulative probability models proportional odds assumptions generate ROC curves reflect ordinal nature outcome. Provides cumulative AUC across thresholds, partial proportional odds models, ordinal-specific performance metrics. Essential biomarker validation grading systems, staging algorithms, scenario outcome 2 ordered levels. Particularly valuable pathology grading staging fundamental diagnosis prognosis (Gleason score, Nottingham grade, FIGO stage, etc.).

title: Ordinal ROC Analysis ‚Äî ordinalroc
code: ordinalroc(   data,   predictor,   ordinal_outcome,   outcome_order,   roc_method = "empirical",   cumulative_direction = "geq",   calculate_auc = TRUE,   auc_ci_method = "delong",   bootstrap_samples = 1000,   confidence_level = 0.95,   category_specific_auc = TRUE,   test_proportional_odds = TRUE,   show_coefficients = TRUE,   partial_proportional_odds = FALSE,   optimal_thresholds = TRUE,   threshold_method = "youden",   sensitivity_target = 0.8,   specificity_target = 0.8,   plot_ordinal_roc = TRUE,   plot_all_cumulative = TRUE,   plot_category_distributions = TRUE,   plot_cumulative_probabilities = FALSE,   plot_confusion_matrix = FALSE,   clinical_context = "general",   show_interpretation = TRUE,   stratified_analysis = FALSE,   stratify_by,   covariate_adjustment = FALSE,   covariates,   compare_predictors = FALSE,   additional_predictors,   auc_comparison_test = TRUE,   missing_handling = "complete",   random_seed = 123 )

title: Ordinal ROC Analysis ‚Äî ordinalroc
text: data data data frame. predictor Continuous predictor variable (biomarker level, risk score, imaging feature) used predict ordinal outcome. increase decrease monotonically outcome severity. ordinal_outcome Ordered categorical outcome variable 3 levels representing increasing severity progression (e.g., well/moderate/poor differentiation, stage /II/III/IV, FIGO stage, fibrosis score F0-F4). outcome_order Specify correct ordering outcome levels lowest highest severity. ensures proper cumulative probability calculation. example, tumor differentiation, order : well, moderate, poor. roc_method Method constructing ordinal ROC curves. Empirical uses observed cumulative distributions (non-parametric), binormal assumes normal distributions within categories, proportional odds uses logistic regression framework. cumulative_direction Direction cumulative probabilities. Use ‚â• higher predictor values indicate higher severity (e.g., higher biomarker = worse grade). Use ‚â§ lower predictor values indicate higher severity. calculate_auc Calculate area ordinal ROC curve. ordinal outcomes, often called concordance probability generalized AUC. Values >0.5 indicate discriminatory ability. auc_ci_method Method calculating confidence intervals around AUC. DeLong faster, bootstrap accurate small samples. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples confidence interval estimation using bootstrap method. confidence_level Confidence level interval estimation around AUC metrics. category_specific_auc Calculate AUC cumulative dichotomization (e.g., grades 1/2/3, calculate AUC 1 vs 2+3, 1+2 vs 3). Shows discriminatory ability threshold. test_proportional_odds Test whether proportional odds assumption holds. assumption states effect predictor across category thresholds. Violation suggests non-proportional odds model may needed. show_coefficients Display coefficients proportional odds logistic regression model. Shows log-odds ratio predictor threshold intercepts. partial_proportional_odds proportional odds assumption violated, fit partial proportional odds model predictor effects can vary across thresholds. optimal_thresholds Identify optimal predictor thresholds cumulative dichotomization using Youden index criteria. threshold_method Method selecting optimal threshold cumulative split. sensitivity_target Target sensitivity threshold selection using sensitivity-constrained approach. specificity_target Target specificity threshold selection using specificity-constrained approach. plot_ordinal_roc Display ordinal ROC curve(s). empirical method, shows cumulative ROC dichotomization. proportional odds, shows model-based curve. plot_all_cumulative Display separate ROC curves cumulative dichotomization plot. Helps visualize discrimination varies across severity levels. plot_category_distributions Show distribution predictor values stratified outcome category. Visualizes separation ordinal levels. plot_cumulative_probabilities Display cumulative probability curves function predictor value. Shows predicted probabilities change predictor level. plot_confusion_matrix Show confusion matrix using optimal thresholds classify observations ordinal categories. clinical_context Clinical context interpretation guidance. Provides context-specific recommendations threshold selection clinical application. show_interpretation Provide clinical interpretation results including guidance biomarker utility distinguishing ordinal categories. stratified_analysis Perform stratified ordinal ROC analysis important subgroups assess consistency biomarker performance across populations. stratify_by Variable defining strata stratified analysis (e.g., age group, sex, institution). level receives separate ordinal ROC analysis. covariate_adjustment Adjust ordinal ROC analysis covariates (confounders) using regression framework. Useful scanner effects, batch effects, demographic variables. covariates Variables adjust covariate-adjusted ordinal ROC analysis. compare_predictors Compare multiple predictor variables ordinal outcome determine biomarker superior discrimination across ordinal categories. additional_predictors Additional continuous predictors compare primary predictor. receive ordinal ROC analysis AUC comparison tests. auc_comparison_test comparing multiple predictors, perform statistical test differences AUC values (DeLong test bootstrap comparison). missing_handling Method handling missing data predictor outcome variables. random_seed Random seed bootstrap sampling stochastic procedures. Ensures reproducible results.

title: Outcome Organizer for Survival Analysis ‚Äî outcomeorganizer
text: data data data frame. outcome primary outcome variable recoded survival analysis (e.g., vital status). outcomeLevel level outcome variable represents event interest (e.g., "Death", "Relapse"). recurrence Variable indicating disease recurrence progression (RFS/PFS/DFS analyses). recurrenceLevel level indicating recurrence progression occurred. patientID Patient identifier handling multiple records applying event hierarchies. analysistype type survival analysis prepare outcome . multievent true, allows multiple event types (e.g., death disease vs death causes). dod level representing death disease interest. dooc level representing death causes disease interest. awd level representing patients alive disease. awod level representing patients alive disease-free. useHierarchy true, applies hierarchy multiple events occur patient. eventPriority event code (e.g., 1, 2) takes precedence multiple events occur. intervalCensoring true, prepares data interval-censored analysis exact event times unknown. intervalStart Variable containing start interval event might occurred. intervalEnd Variable containing end interval event might occurred. adminCensoring true, applies administrative censoring specified date. adminDate Variable containing administrative censoring date. outputTable true, displays table showing frequency recoded outcome value. diagnostics true, displays diagnostic information recoding process. visualization true, displays visualization distribution recoded outcomes. showNaturalSummary Display plain-language summary recoding suitable copying reports. showGlossary Display definitions survival analysis terms.

title: Outcome Organizer for Survival Analysis ‚Äî outcomeorganizer
code: # \donttest{ # Example 1: Overall survival analysis data('lung', package = 'survival') #> Warning: data set ‚Äòlung‚Äô not found outcomeorganizer(     data = lung,     outcome = status,     outcomeLevel = 2,     analysistype = 'os',     addOutcome = TRUE ) #> Error in outcomeorganizer(data = lung, outcome = status, outcomeLevel = 2,     analysistype = "os", addOutcome = TRUE): unused argument (addOutcome = TRUE)  # Example 2: Competing risks (disease death vs other death) # Create example data with multiple event types mydata <- data.frame(     vital_status = factor(c('Alive_NED', 'Alive_Disease', 'Dead_Disease', 'Dead_Other')),     time = c(10, 15, 20, 25) )  outcomeorganizer(     data = mydata,     outcome = vital_status,     analysistype = 'compete',     multievent = TRUE,     dod = 'Dead_Disease',     dooc = 'Dead_Other',     awd = 'Alive_Disease',     awod = 'Alive_NED',     addOutcome = TRUE ) #> Error in outcomeorganizer(data = mydata, outcome = vital_status, analysistype = "compete",     multievent = TRUE, dod = "Dead_Disease", dooc = "Dead_Other",     awd = "Alive_Disease", awod = "Alive_NED", addOutcome = TRUE): unused argument (addOutcome = TRUE)  # Example 3: Progression-free survival with recurrence mydata <- data.frame(     vital = factor(c('Alive', 'Alive', 'Dead', 'Alive')),     recurrence = factor(c('No', 'Yes', 'No', 'No')),     time = c(10, 15, 20, 25) )  outcomeorganizer(     data = mydata,     outcome = vital,     outcomeLevel = 'Dead',     recurrence = recurrence,     recurrenceLevel = 'Yes',     analysistype = 'pfs',     addOutcome = TRUE ) #> Error in outcomeorganizer(data = mydata, outcome = vital, outcomeLevel = "Dead",     recurrence = recurrence, recurrenceLevel = "Yes", analysistype = "pfs",     addOutcome = TRUE): unused argument (addOutcome = TRUE) # }

title: Outlier Detection ‚Äî outlierdetection
text: data data data frame. vars Continuous variables analyze outliers. module detect outliers based selected variables using chosen detection methods. method_category Category outlier detection methods use. CLINICAL GUIDANCE: Univariate methods analyze variable separately (ideal lab values, vital signs). Multivariate methods consider relationships variables (useful correlated biomarkers). Composite combines multiple approaches robust detection (recommended clinical data). Examples: Use univariate hemoglobin levels, multivariate complete blood count panels. univariate_methods Specific univariate method outlier detection univariate category selected. multivariate_methods Specific multivariate method outlier detection multivariate category selected. composite_threshold Threshold composite outlier score (0.1-1.0). Default 0.5 means observations  classified outliers least half methods considered outliers. zscore_threshold Threshold Z-score based methods. CLINICAL EXAMPLES: 3.0 = 99.7\ 3.29 = 99.9\ enzymes), 2.5 = 98.8\ Recommended: 3.29 clinical quality control. iqr_multiplier Multiplier IQR-based outlier detection. CLINICAL EXAMPLES: 1.5 = Tukey's standard (sensitive, may flag ~0.7\ data), 1.7 = conservative (recommended clinical screening), 2.0 = conservative (critical biomarkers). title: Outlier Detection with easystats ‚Äî outlierdetectionClass
text: outlier detection module supports four main categories methods: Univariate Methods: Robust Z-Score (MAD-based): Uses median absolute deviation robust standardization Standard Z-Score: Classical z-score based mean standard deviation Interquartile Range (IQR): Tukey's method using quartiles IQR multiplier Equal-Tailed Interval (ETI): Symmetric confidence interval approach Highest Density Interval (HDI): Bayesian credible interval method Multivariate Methods: Mahalanobis Distance: Classical multivariate distance accounting covariance Robust Mahalanobis Distance: Robust version using minimum covariance determinant Minimum Covariance Determinant (MCD): Robust covariance estimation OPTICS Clustering: Density-based clustering approach Local Outlier Factor (LOF): Local density deviation method Composite Methods: Combine multiple algorithms robust detection adjustable thresholds Methods: Comprehensive analysis using available techniques

title: Patient Similarity Clustering ‚Äî patientsimilarity
text: Visualizes patient similarity using dimensionality reduction techniques (PCA, t-SNE, UMAP, MDS). Projects high-dimensional patient data 2D 3D space reveal natural patient groupings subpopulations. Inspired Orange Data Mining's interactive projection widgets, adapted jamovi comprehensive cluster analysis statistical validation.

title: Patient Similarity Clustering ‚Äî patientsimilarity
code: patientsimilarity(   data,   vars = NULL,   seed = 123,   method = "tsne",   dimensions = "2",   colorBy = NULL,   perplexity = 30,   iterations = 1000,   umapNeighbors = 15,   umapMinDist = 0.1,   performClustering = FALSE,   clusterMethod = "kmeans",   nClusters = 3,   dbscan_eps = 0.5,   dbscan_minpts = 5,   showClusterStats = FALSE,   survivalAnalysis = FALSE,   survivalTime = NULL,   survivalEvent = NULL,   survivalEventLevel,   scaleVars = FALSE,   removeOutliers = FALSE,   showLoadings = FALSE,   show3DPlot = FALSE )

title: Patient Similarity Clustering ‚Äî patientsimilarity
text: data dataset analyzed, provided data frame. vars Continuous variables use calculating patient similarity. used compute distances patients. Categorical variables converted numeric one-hot encoded. seed Random seed reproducibility t-SNE, UMAP, clustering results. method Method dimensionality reduction: - PCA: Linear method, preserves global structure - t-SNE: Non-linear, excellent visualization, preserves local structure - UMAP: Non-linear, preserves local global structure, faster t-SNE - MDS: Classical method, preserves pairwise distances dimensions Number dimensions projection. 2D easier interpret, 3D can reveal additional structure. colorBy Variable use coloring points. Typically outcome variable (e.g., disease status, survival, response) see corresponds natural patient groupings. perplexity Perplexity parameter t-SNE. Roughly corresponds number nearest neighbors considered. Typical values: 5-50. Higher values preserve global structure. iterations Number iterations t-SNE optimization. iterations improve convergence take longer. umapNeighbors Number nearest neighbors UMAP. Controls local vs global structure. Smaller values preserve local structure, larger values preserve global. umapMinDist Minimum distance points UMAP. Controls tightly points packed. Smaller values create tighter clusters. performClustering Automatically identify patient clusters using k-means hierarchical clustering reduced-dimension space. clusterMethod Method clustering patients reduced space. nClusters Number clusters k-means hierarchical clustering. DBSCAN, ignored. dbscan_eps radius neighborhood around point (eps) DBSCAN. dbscan_minpts minimum number points required form dense region (MinPts) DBSCAN. showClusterStats Display summary statistics cluster including size, characteristics, outcome distribution. survivalAnalysis survival data available, compare survival across discovered clusters. Useful identifying prognostic patient subtypes. survivalTime Time event censoring survival analysis. survivalEvent Event indicator (1=event, 0=censored). survivalEventLevel Level indicating event occurred. scaleVars Standardize variables mean=0, sd=1 analysis. Recommended variables different scales. removeOutliers Remove outliers analysis using IQR method. May improve visualization quality. showLoadings Show original variables contribute dimension. available PCA MDS. show3DPlot Generate interactive 3D plot using plotly (dimensions=3).

code: # Example 1: Basic t-SNE visualization library(Rtsne) data(iris)  patientsimilarity(     data = iris,     vars = c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width", "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width"),     method = "tsne",     colorBy = "Species" ) #> Error in patientsimilarity(data = iris, vars = c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width",     "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width"), method = "tsne", colorBy = "Species"): argument "survivalEventLevel" is missing, with no default  # Example 2: UMAP with cluster analysis patientsimilarity(     data = clinical_data,     vars = c("age", "tumor_size", "grade", "ki67"),     method = "umap",     colorBy = "survival_status",     performClustering = TRUE,     nClusters = 3,     showClusterStats = TRUE ) #> Error in patientsimilarity(data = clinical_data, vars = c("age", "tumor_size",     "grade", "ki67"), method = "umap", colorBy = "survival_status",     performClustering = TRUE, nClusters = 3, showClusterStats = TRUE): argument "survivalEventLevel" is missing, with no default  # Example 3: PCA with survival comparison patientsimilarity(     data = pathology_data,     vars = c("age", "stage", "nodes", "size"),     method = "pca",     colorBy = "death",     dimensions = 3,     survivalTime = "months",     survivalEvent = "death" ) #> Error in patientsimilarity(data = pathology_data, vars = c("age", "stage",     "nodes", "size"), method = "pca", colorBy = "death", dimensions = 3,     survivalTime = "months", survivalEvent = "death"): argument "survivalEventLevel" is missing, with no default

what: Patient Similarity Clustering - Discover Patient Subgroups ‚Äî patientsimilarityClass
title: Patient Similarity Clustering - Discover Patient Subgroups ‚Äî patientsimilarityClass
text: Visualizes patient similarity using dimensionality reduction techniques (PCA, t-SNE, UMAP, MDS). Projects high-dimensional patient data 2D 3D space reveal natural patient groupings. Inspired Orange Data Mining's interactive projection widgets, adapted jamovi comprehensive cluster analysis statistical validation.

title: Patient Similarity Clustering - Discover Patient Subgroups ‚Äî patientsimilarityClass
text: analysis performs dimensionality reduction visualize patient similarity: PCA: Linear method preserving global variance structure t-SNE: Non-linear method excellent visualization, preserves local neighborhoods UMAP: Non-linear method preserving local global structure, faster t-SNE MDS: Classical scaling method preserving pairwise distances Optional cluster analysis identifies patient subgroups using k-means, hierarchical clustering, DBSCAN. Survival analysis can compare outcomes across discovered clusters.

title: PCA Component Significance Test ‚Äî pcacomponenttest
code: pcacomponenttest(   data,   vars,   ncomp = 5,   nperm = 1000,   stop_rule = TRUE,   seed = 123,   center = TRUE,   scale = TRUE,   conflevel = 0.95,   adjustmethod = "BH",   showpercent = TRUE,   colororiginal = "#0072B2",   colorpermuted = "#E69F00",   showScreePlot = FALSE,   showLoadingsPlot = FALSE,   nLoadings = 5,   plotwidth = 600,   plotheight = 450,   showSummary = FALSE,   showGuide = FALSE )

title: PCA Component Significance Test ‚Äî pcacomponenttest
text: data data data frame. vars Continuous variables include Principal Component Analysis. Select least 3 numeric variables. ncomp Number principal components test significance (1 20). Testing performed PC1 specified number components. nperm Number permutations generate null distribution (100-10000). Higher values provide accurate p-values take longer. Minimum p-value = 1/(nperm+1). p<0.001, use nperm>=1000. stop_rule Stop testing first non-significant component (Sequential Testing). Recommended: TRUE prevent Type error inflation. FALSE, components ncomp tested (Batch Testing). seed Random seed reproducibility permutation results. center Center variables mean = 0 PCA. Recommended: TRUE analyses. scale Scale variables standard deviation = 1 PCA. Recommended: TRUE variables different units scales. conflevel Confidence level confidence intervals (0.80-0.99). Default: 0.95 95\ adjustmethodMethod adjusting p-values multiple testing. BH (Benjamini-Hochberg) controls false discovery rate. showpercentDisplay variance accounted (VAF) percentage (0-100) instead proportion (0-1). colororiginalColor original VAF line/points. Use color names hex codes. Default color-blind safe blue. colorpermutedColor permuted VAF line/points. Use color names hex codes. Default color-blind safe orange. showScreePlotDisplay scree plot eigenvalues. showLoadingsPlotDisplay plot variable loadings significant components. nLoadingsNumber top variables display loadings plot. plotwidthWidth plot pixels. plotheightHeight plot pixels. showSummaryDisplay natural-language summary results clinical interpretation. Provides plain-language explanation significant components variance explained. showGuideDisplay guide explaining interpret VAF, p-values, clinical implications. Includes definitions key terms guidance clinical use. results object containing: component tested permutation null distribution Significant components variance REMOVED testing next component Testing STOPS first non-significant component found # Example mtcars dataset data("mtcars")# Test significance first 5 principal components pcacomponenttest(   data = mtcars,   vars = c("mpg", "disp", "hp", "drat", "wt", "qsec"),   ncomp = 5,   nperm = 1000,   center = TRUE,   scale = TRUE,   conflevel = 0.95,   adjustmethod = "BH" )

text: data data data frame. vars Continuous variables include Principal Component Analysis. Select least 3 numeric variables. ncomp Number principal components display (1 10). cutoff Threshold marking loadings significant (0 1). Loadings |loading| >= cutoff marked stars star_values enabled. center Center variables PCA. scale Scale variables PCA. textvalues Display numeric loading values heatmap/barmap cells. starvalues Display stars (*) loadings >= cutoff threshold. relevant textvalues FALSE. textsize Font size text plots. plotlegend Display legend barmap plot. plotcutoff Display horizontal lines ¬±cutoff threshold barmap. gradientcolor Use gradient colors proportional loading values. FALSE, uses binary colors positive/negative. colorlow Color negative loadings. colormid Midpoint color zero loading. colorhigh Color positive loadings. plotwidth Width plots pixels. plotheight Height plots pixels.

title: PCA Loading Significance Test ‚Äî pcaloadingtest
text: Performs permutation-based significance testing PCA loadings using permV method (Linting et al., 2011). approach permutes one variable time, providing variable-specific component-specific significance thresholds higher statistical power proper Type error control.

title: PCA Loading Significance Test ‚Äî pcaloadingtest
code: pcaloadingtest(   data,   vars,   ncomp = 3,   nperm = 1000,   seed = 123,   componentfilter = 0,   center = TRUE,   scale = TRUE,   conflevel = 0.95,   adjustmethod = "BH",   colorlow = "steelblue1",   colormid = "white",   colorhigh = "firebrick1",   plotwidth = 700,   plotheight = 450 )

title: PCA Loading Significance Test ‚Äî pcaloadingtest
text: data data data frame. vars Continuous variables include Principal Component Analysis. Select least 3 numeric variables. ncomp Number principal components test loadings (1 10). nperm Number permutations per variable (100-5000). Total permutations = nperm √ó number variables. Higher values provide accurate p-values take longer. seed Seed permutation reproducibility. Use seed obtain identical results. componentfilter Filter results table component. 0 shows components, 1 shows PC1, 2 shows PC2, etc. center Center variables mean = 0 PCA. scale Scale variables standard deviation = 1 PCA. conflevel Confidence level confidence intervals (0.80-0.99). adjustmethod Method adjusting p-values within component. BH (Benjamini-Hochberg) controls false discovery rate. colorlow Color negative loadings barplot. colormid Midpoint color zero loading. colorhigh Color positive loadings barplot. plotwidth Width plot pixels. plotheight Height plot pixels.

title: PCA Loading Significance Test ‚Äî pcaloadingtest
text: results object containing: Tables can converted data frames asDF .data.frame. example: results$results$asDF .data.frame(results$results)

title: PCA Loading Significance Test ‚Äî pcaloadingtest
text: Instead arbitrary cutoffs (e.g., |loading| > 0.5), test provides objective, hypothesis-tested thresholds variable component. Procrustes rotation applied handle sign reflection component indeterminacy issues.

title: Penalized Cox Regression ‚Äî penalizedcox
text: data dataset analysis, provided data frame. contain survival variables predictor variables penalized regression. elapsedtime numeric variable representing follow-time event censoring. tint true, survival time calculated diagnosis follow-dates. dxdate Date diagnosis start follow-. Required tint = true. fudate Follow-date date last observation. Required tint = true. timetypedata Specifies format date variables input data. timetypeoutput units survival time reported output. outcome outcome variable indicating event status (e.g., death, recurrence). outcomeLevel level outcome considered event. predictors Variables include penalized Cox regression model. penalty_type Type penalty apply. LASSO performs variable selection, Ridge shrinks coefficients, Elastic Net combines . alpha Mixing parameter Elastic Net. Alpha=1 LASSO, alpha=0 Ridge. Used penalty_type = "elastic_net". lambda_selection Method selecting regularization parameter lambda. lambda_custom Custom lambda value lambda_selection = "custom". cv_folds Number folds cross-validation select optimal lambda. cv_type Cross-validation error measure model selection. variable_selection Extract display selected variables (non-zero coefficients). standardize Whether standardize predictor variables fitting. include_intercept Whether include intercept model (usually false Cox models). bootstrap_validation Perform bootstrap validation penalized model. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples validation. predict_risk Calculate linear predictors (risk scores) observation. survival_curves Generate survival curves stratified risk score groups. risk_groups Number risk groups survival curve stratification. coefficient_plot Display coefficient paths showing shrinkage across lambda values. cv_plot Display cross-validation error plot lambda selection. variable_importance Display variable importance based coefficient magnitudes. lambda_sequence Custom sequence lambda values (comma-separated). empty, glmnet choose automatically. max_variables Maximum number variables include model path. convergence_threshold Convergence threshold coordinate descent algorithm. show_coefficients Display table selected variables coefficients. show_model_metrics Display model performance metrics including deviance C-index. show_lambda_path Display detailed information lambda selection process. showSummaries Display natural language summaries alongside tables plots interpretation penalized Cox regression results. showExplanations Display detailed explanations penalized Cox regression methods interpretation guidelines. addRiskScore Add calculated linear predictor (risk score) new variable dataset. addRiskGroup Add risk group classification new variable dataset.

title: Positive Predictive Value ‚Äî ppv
text: percTrue pre-study probability tested relationships true. exploratory research fields, may 10\ confirmatory research strong theoretical basis, may higher. alpha significance level (Type error rate) used studies. Standard value 0.05, may lower multiple testing situations. power Statistical power studies detect true effects. Well-designed studies typically 80\ studies much lower actual power. percHack Percentage studies questionable research practices (p-hacking, selective reporting, data dredging). represents bias research process increases false positive rates.

title: Precision-Recall Analysis ‚Äî prauc
text: Precision-Recall (PR) analysis superior ROC analysis highly imbalanced datasets, common digital pathology AI applications. ROC curves can misleading negative class vastly outnumbers positive class, PR curves focus performance minority (positive) class. area PR curve (PR-AUC Average Precision) provides single-number summary model performance. PR analysis essential evaluating rare event detection (mitotic figures <1\ positives rare, quality control digital pathology defects uncommon, AI triage systems abnormal cases infrequent. module provides comprehensive PR analysis optimal threshold selection, comparison baseline (random classifier), F-score optimization different precision-recall trade-offs.

title: Precision-Recall Analysis ‚Äî prauc
code: prauc(   data,   outcome,   predictor,   positive_level = "",   prevalence = -1,   calculate_auc = TRUE,   calculate_fscore = TRUE,   beta_weights = "1, 2, 0.5",   confidence_intervals = TRUE,   ci_method = "bootstrap",   bootstrap_samples = 1000,   confidence_level = 0.95,   compare_to_roc = TRUE,   baseline_comparison = TRUE,   interpolation_method = "step",   plot_pr_curve = TRUE,   plot_comparison = FALSE,   plot_fscore = FALSE,   min_threshold = 0,   max_threshold = 1,   random_seed = 12345 )

title: Precision-Recall Analysis ‚Äî prauc
text: data data data frame. outcome Binary outcome variable (e.g., cancer/non-cancer, positive/negative). Must exactly two levels. predictor Continuous predictor variable (e.g., AI score, biomarker level, probability). Higher values indicate higher likelihood positive outcome. positive_level Level outcome variable treat "positive" class. specified, second level factor used. Critical correct PR analysis. prevalence Observed prevalence positive class dataset. Automatically calculated specified (-1). Used baseline comparison interpretation. calculate_auc Calculate area precision-recall curve (also called Average Precision). Uses trapezoidal integration. Essential summary metric imbalanced data. calculate_fscore Find optimal threshold maximizes F1-score (harmonic mean precision recall). Also calculates F2-score (emphasizes recall) F0.5-score (emphasizes precision). beta_weights Comma-separated list beta values F-score calculation. F1 (beta=1) balances precision recall. F2 (beta=2) weights recall higher. F0.5 (beta=0.5) weights precision higher. Example: "1, 2, 0.5, 3" confidence_intervals Calculate confidence intervals PR-AUC using bootstrap resampling. Provides uncertainty quantification imbalanced datasets. ci_method Method confidence interval calculation. Bootstrap percentile standard. BCa (bias-corrected accelerated) adjusts skewness. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap resamples confidence interval calculation. confidence_level Confidence level interval estimation. compare_to_roc Calculate ROC-AUC comparison. Demonstrates advantage PR analysis imbalanced data ROC-AUC may misleadingly high. baseline_comparison Compare PR-AUC baseline (random classifier). Baseline PR-AUC equals prevalence. Shows improvement chance performance. interpolation_method Method interpolating PR curve points. Step function standard PR curves. Linear interpolation can smooth curve. plot_pr_curve Plot precision-recall curve optimal F-score threshold marked. Shows trade-precision recall across thresholds. plot_comparison Side--side comparison ROC PR curves demonstrate differences imbalanced dataset evaluation. plot_fscore Plot F-scores (F1, F2, F0.5) across thresholds visualize optimal operating points different precision-recall trade-offs. min_threshold Minimum predictor threshold evaluate. Use focus clinically relevant range. max_threshold Maximum predictor threshold evaluate. random_seed Random seed bootstrap procedures ensure reproducibility.

title: Precision-Recall Curve ‚Äî precisionrecall

title: Precision-Recall Curve ‚Äî precisionrecall
text: data data data frame outcome Binary outcome variable (0/1, TRUE/FALSE, factor 2 levels) positiveClass Value representing positive class (disease/event) scores One continuous variables containing classifier scores predicted probabilities interpolation PRC requires non-linear interpolation. Linear shown educational comparison. showBaseline Display horizontal baseline y = P/(P+N) representing random classifier aucMethod Method calculating area PRC curve ci . ciMethod . ciSamples . ciWidth . comparison Perform statistical comparison multiple PRC curves comparisonMethod . showROC Display ROC curve alongside PRC comparison showFScore Display F‚ÇÅ score iso-lines PRC plot

title: Advanced ROC Analysis ‚Äî psychopdaROC
text: clinicalMode Select complexity level analysis: Basic - Essential ROC metrics clinical decision making Advanced - Additional statistical comparisons metrics Comprehensive - Full research-grade analysis options data data data frame. dependentVars Test variable(s) evaluated classification performance. Multiple variables can selected comparison. classVar Binary classification variable representing true class (gold standard). Must exactly two levels. positiveClass Specifies level class variable treated positive class. subGroup Optional grouping variable stratified analysis. ROC curves calculated separately group. clinicalPreset Choose preset configuration optimized specific clinical scenarios: Screening - High sensitivity avoid missing cases Confirmation - High specificity avoid false positives Balanced - Equal weight sensitivity specificity Research - Comprehensive analysis publication method Method determining optimal cutpoint. Different methods optimize different aspects classifier performance. metric Metric optimize determining cutpoint.  applies maximize/minimize methods. direction Direction classification relative cutpoint. Use '>=' higher test values indicate positive class. specifyCutScore Specific cutpoint value use method set 'Manual cutpoint'. tol_metric Tolerance metric value multiple cutpoints yield similar performance. Cutpoints within tolerance considered equivalent. break_ties Method handling ties multiple cutpoints achieve metric value. allObserved Display performance metrics observed test values potential cutpoints, just optimal cutpoint. boot_runs Number bootstrap iterations methods using bootstrapping. Set 0 disable bootstrapping. seed Random seed reproducibility bootstrap permutation tests. usePriorPrev Use specified prior prevalence instead sample prevalence calculating predictive values. priorPrev Population prevalence use predictive value calculations. used 'Use Prior Prevalence' checked. costratioFP Relative cost false positives compared false negatives. Values > 1 penalize false positives heavily. sensSpecTable Display detailed confusion matrices optimal cutpoints. showThresholdTable Display detailed table performance metrics multiple thresholds. maxThresholds Maximum number threshold values show threshold table. delongTest Test whether diagnostic performance differs significantly multiple tests. Uses DeLong's method compare Area Curve (AUC) values. Requires least two test variables. plotROC Display ROC curves visual assessment classifier performance. combinePlots multiple test variables selected, combine ROC curves single plot. cleanPlot Create clean ROC curves without annotations, suitable publications. showOptimalPoint Display optimal cutpoint ROC curve. displaySE Display standard error bands ROC curves (LOESS smoothing applied). smoothing Apply LOESS smoothing ROC curves visualization. showConfidenceBands Display confidence bands around ROC curve. legendPosition Position legend plots multiple ROC curves. directLabel Label curves directly plot instead using legend. interactiveROC Create interactive HTML ROC plot (requires plotROC package). showCriterionPlot Plot showing sensitivity specificity change across different thresholds. showPrevalencePlot Plot showing PPV NPV change disease prevalence. showDotPlot Dot plot showing distribution test values class. precisionRecallCurve Display precision-recall curves alongside ROC curves. partialAUC Calculate AUC specific region ROC curve. partialAUCfrom Lower bound specificity range partial AUC calculation. partialAUCto Upper bound specificity range partial AUC calculation. rocSmoothingMethod Method smoothing ROC curve (requires pROC package). bootstrapCI Calculate bootstrap confidence intervals AUC optimal cutpoints. bootstrapReps Number bootstrap replications confidence interval calculation. quantileCIs Display confidence intervals specific quantiles test variable. quantiles Comma-separated list quantiles (0-1) display confidence intervals. compareClassifiers Perform comprehensive comparison classifier performance metrics. calculateIDI Calculate much better one test discriminating diseased healthy patients. IDI (Integrated Discrimination Improvement) measures average improvement predicted probabilities. calculateNRI Calculate many patients correctly reclassified using new test. NRI (Net Reclassification Index) measures net improvement patient classification. refVar Reference test variable IDI NRI calculations. variables compared reference. nriThresholds Comma-separated probability thresholds (0-1) defining risk categories NRI. Leave empty continuous NRI. idiNriBootRuns Number bootstrap iterations IDI NRI confidence intervals. effectSizeAnalysis Calculate effect sizes ROC curve differences using Cohen's conventions standardized mean differences AUC values. powerAnalysis Perform statistical power analysis ROC curve comparisons including sample size estimation power calculations detecting AUC differences. powerAnalysisType Type power analysis perform. expectedAUCDifference Expected difference AUC values power calculations sample size estimation. targetPower Target statistical power sample size calculations (typically 0.8 0.9). significanceLevel Type error rate power calculations (typically 0.05). correlationROCs Expected correlation paired ROC curves power calculations. Use 0.5 moderate correlation, 0.0 independent samples. bayesianAnalysis Perform bootstrap-based ROC analysis optional prior weighting estimate uncertainty AUC. Uses bootstrap resampling create empirical distribution. NOTE: full Bayesian MCMC inference; uses bootstrap simulation prior parameters weights. Interpret "credible intervals" bootstrap percentile confidence intervals. priorAUC Prior belief AUC value Bayesian analysis (center prior distribution). priorPrecision Precision prior belief (higher values = confident prior). clinicalUtilityAnalysis Perform clinical utility analysis including net benefit curves, decision curve analysis, clinical impact assessment. treatmentThreshold Treatment threshold range decision curve analysis (min,max,step). Example: "0.05,0.5,0.05" creates thresholds 5\ harmBenefitRatioRatio harm unnecessary treatment benefit necessary treatment. Lower values favor aggressive treatment policies. interventionCostInclude cost-effectiveness considerations clinical utility analysis. fixedSensSpecAnalysisDetermine cutoffs based fixed sensitivity specificity values display corresponding performance metrics. fixedAnalysisTypeChoose whether fix sensitivity specificity value cutoff determination. fixedSensitivityValueTarget sensitivity value (0-1) determining corresponding cutoff specificity. fixedSpecificityValueTarget specificity value (0-1) determining corresponding cutoff sensitivity. showFixedROCDisplay separate ROC curve highlighting fixed sensitivity/specificity point. fixedInterpolationMethod interpolating observed points achieve target sensitivity/specificity. showFixedExplanationDisplay explanatory guide fixed sensitivity/specificity analysis including  clinical interpretation, interpolation methods, usage recommendations. metaAnalysisPerform meta-analysis AUC values across multiple test variables. Requires least 3 test variables enable pooled effect estimation. metaAnalysisMethodStatistical method combining AUC estimates across studies/variables. heterogeneityTestPerform Cochran's Q test calculate ¬≤ statistic assess heterogeneity AUC estimates. forestPlotCreate forest plot visualization individual pooled AUC estimates confidence intervals. overrideMetaAnalysisWarningADVANCED OPTION: Bypass independence assumption check meta-analysis. WARNING - use fully understand statistical implications. Meta-analysis non-independent data produces invalid results used formal inference. Use DeLong's test instead within-study comparisons multiple markers. results object containing:

title: Comprehensive ROC Analysis with Advanced Features ‚Äî psychopdaROCClass
text: Performs sophisticated Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curve analysis optimal cutpoint determination, multiple comparison methods, advanced statistical features including IDI/NRI calculations, DeLong test, comprehensive visualization options.

title: Comprehensive ROC Analysis with Advanced Features ‚Äî psychopdaROCClass
text: psychopdaROCResults object containing: resultsTable: Detailed results threshold simpleResultsTable: Summary AUC results confidence intervals sensSpecTable: Confusion matrix optimal cutpoint plotROC: ROC curve visualization delongTest: DeLong test results (requested) idiTable: IDI results confidence intervals (requested) nriTable: NRI results confidence intervals (requested) Additional plots tables based options selected

title: Comprehensive ROC Analysis with Advanced Features ‚Äî psychopdaROCClass
text: function provides extensive ROC analysis toolkit goes beyond basic ROC curve generation. Key features include: Core ROC Analysis: AUC calculation confidence intervals Multiple cutpoint optimization methods (12 different approaches) 16 different optimization metrics (Youden, accuracy, F1, etc.) Bootstrap confidence intervals Manual cutpoint specification Advanced Statistical Methods: DeLong test comparing multiple AUCs IDI (Integrated Discrimination Index) bootstrap CI NRI (Net Reclassification Index) bootstrap CI Partial AUC calculations ROC curve smoothing (multiple methods) Classifier performance comparison Visualization Options: ROC curves (individual combined) Sensitivity/specificity vs threshold plots Predictive value vs prevalence plots Precision-recall curves Dot plots showing class distributions Interactive ROC plots Confidence bands quantile confidence intervals Subgroup Analysis: Stratified analysis grouping variables Cost-benefit optimization custom cost ratios Hospital/site comparisons

title: Comprehensive ROC Analysis with Advanced Features ‚Äî psychopdaROCClass

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load example medical data data(medical_roc_data)  # Basic ROC analysis result1 <- psychopdaROC(   data = medical_roc_data,   dependentVars = "biomarker1",   classVar = "disease_status",    positiveClass = "Disease" )  # Compare multiple biomarkers with DeLong test result2 <- psychopdaROC(   data = medical_roc_data,   dependentVars = c("biomarker1", "biomarker2", "biomarker3"),   classVar = "disease_status",   positiveClass = "Disease",   delongTest = TRUE,   combinePlots = TRUE )  # Advanced analysis with IDI/NRI result3 <- psychopdaROC(   data = medical_roc_data,   dependentVars = c("biomarker1", "biomarker2"),   classVar = "disease_status",   positiveClass = "Disease",    calculateIDI = TRUE,   calculateNRI = TRUE,   refVar = "biomarker1",   nriThresholds = "0.3,0.7" )  # Cost-benefit optimization result4 <- psychopdaROC(   data = medical_roc_data,   dependentVars = "biomarker1",   classVar = "disease_status",   positiveClass = "Disease",   method = "oc_cost_ratio",   costratioFP = 2.5  # False positives cost 2.5x false negatives )  # Subgroup analysis by hospital result5 <- psychopdaROC(   data = medical_roc_data,   dependentVars = "biomarker1",   classVar = "disease_status",   positiveClass = "Disease",   subGroup = "hospital" )  # Comprehensive analysis with all features result6 <- psychopdaROC(   data = medical_roc_data,   dependentVars = c("biomarker1", "biomarker2"),   classVar = "disease_status",   positiveClass = "Disease",   method = "maximize_metric",   metric = "youden",   plotROC = TRUE,   sensSpecTable = TRUE,   showThresholdTable = TRUE,   delongTest = TRUE,   calculateIDI = TRUE,   partialAUC = TRUE,   bootstrapCI = TRUE,   precisionRecallCurve = TRUE,   compareClassifiers = TRUE )  # Financial risk assessment example data(financial_roc_data)  financial_result <- psychopdaROC(   data = financial_roc_data,   dependentVars = c("credit_score", "income_debt_ratio", "employment_score"),   classVar = "default_status",   positiveClass = "Default",   direction = "<=",  # Lower credit scores indicate higher risk   method = "oc_cost_ratio",   costratioFP = 0.1,  # False positives (rejected good clients) cost less   delongTest = TRUE,   subGroup = "client_type" )  # Educational assessment example data(education_roc_data)  education_result <- psychopdaROC(   data = education_roc_data,   dependentVars = c("exam_score", "project_score", "peer_score"),   classVar = "pass_status",   positiveClass = "Pass",   method = "maximize_metric",   metric = "accuracy",   calculateIDI = TRUE,   refVar = "exam_score",   subGroup = "class_section" )  # Manufacturing quality control example data(manufacturing_roc_data)  quality_result <- psychopdaROC(   data = manufacturing_roc_data,    dependentVars = c("dimension_score", "surface_score", "strength_score"),   classVar = "quality_status",   positiveClass = "Defect",   method = "oc_equal_sens_spec",  # Balanced sensitivity/specificity   plotROC = TRUE,   showCriterionPlot = TRUE,   showDotPlot = TRUE,   subGroup = "production_line" ) } # }
