title: Q-TWiST Analysis ‚Äî qtwist
code: qtwist(   data,   time_os,   event_os,   event_os_level,   time_pfs,   event_pfs,   event_pfs_level,   treatment,   toxicity_method = "fixed_window",   toxicity_window = 3,   toxicity_probability = 0.5,   toxicity_duration_var,   toxicity_indicator_var,   toxicity_indicator_level,   toxicity_start_var,   toxicity_end_var,   tau = 24,   tau_selection = "user_specified",   utility_tox = 0.5,   utility_twist = 1,   utility_rel = 0.5,   sensitivity_analysis = TRUE,   utility_range_tox = "0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0",   utility_range_rel = "0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0",   threshold_analysis = FALSE,   confidence_level = 0.95,   bootstrap_ci = TRUE,   bootstrap_samples = 1000,   bootstrap_seed = 2025,   stratify_by,   pooled_analysis = TRUE,   show_state_partition = TRUE,   show_qtwist_scores = TRUE,   show_treatment_difference = TRUE,   show_sensitivity_table = TRUE,   show_rmst_components = FALSE,   show_descriptive_stats = TRUE,   plot_partitioned_survival = TRUE,   plot_qtwist_comparison = TRUE,   plot_sensitivity = TRUE,   plot_km_curves = FALSE,   plot_color_scheme = "clinical",   showExplanations = TRUE,   showClinicalGuidance = TRUE,   showFormulas = FALSE,   showReferences = TRUE )

title: Q-TWiST Analysis ‚Äî qtwist
text: data Dataset containing overall survival, progression-free survival, toxicity information. time_os Time death censoring consistent units (months recommended). represents total follow-time randomization/enrollment. event_os Event indicator overall survival. Can numeric (1=death, 0=censored) factor (specify death level ). event_os_level level indicating death using factor variables (e.g., "Dead", "Deceased"). numeric, use level "1" death. time_pfs Time disease progression, relapse, death (whichever comes first). Must units overall survival time. PFS time ‚â§ OS time patient. event_pfs Event indicator progression-free survival. 1 = progression death, 0 = censored (specify factor level). event_pfs_level level indicating progression death using factor variables. treatment Treatment group variable comparison. Q-TWiST analysis requires exactly 2 treatment groups comparison. analysis use available levels (must exactly 2 groups). toxicity_method Method defining toxicity (TOX) period Q-TWiST analysis. Fixed window uses period patients; individual duration allows patient-specific toxicity times. toxicity_window Duration toxicity assessment window months (default: 3 months). Commonly used values: 3 months (1 treatment cycle), 6 months (adjuvant therapy). defines TOX period patients using fixed window method. toxicity_probability Proportion patients experiencing grade 3-4 toxicity window. Used toxicity indicator variable provided. Can estimated pilot data literature. toxicity_duration_var Variable containing individual patient toxicity durations (months). patients without toxicity, use 0. toxicity, specify duration grade 3-4 adverse events. toxicity_indicator_var Optional binary indicator whether patient experienced grade 3-4 toxicity. provided, used weight toxicity time calculations. toxicity_indicator_level Level indicating presence grade 3-4 toxicity (e.g., "Yes", "Grade 3-4", 1). toxicity_start_var Time toxicity begins (months baseline). Use 0 toxicity starting treatment initiation. toxicity_end_var Time toxicity resolves (months baseline). TOX duration = toxicity_end - toxicity_start. tau Restricted time horizon Q-TWiST analysis months. survival estimates restricted maximum follow-time. Common values: 24 months (2 years), 36 months (3 years), 60 months (5 years). Choose based median survival clinical relevance. tau_selection Method selecting time horizon (tau). User-specified allows manual entry; automatic methods select based data characteristics. utility_tox Quality--life utility weight time treatment toxicity. 0 = worst possible health, 1 = perfect health. Typical range: 0.3-0.7 depending toxicity severity. Literature values: chemotherapy toxicity ‚âà 0.5, severe toxicity ‚âà 0.3. utility_twist Quality--life utility weight time without symptoms toxicity. Typically set 1.0 (perfect health) reference state. generally ‚â• utility_tox ‚â• utility_rel. utility_rel Quality--life utility weight time disease relapse/progression. Accounts symptomatic disease burden. Typical range: 0.3-0.6 depending disease severity symptoms. Literature values: metastatic disease ‚âà 0.5, symptomatic relapse ‚âà 0.4. sensitivity_analysis Examine Q-TWiST results vary across different utility weight assumptions. Essential robust conclusions, utility weights subjective. Shows treatment preference changes based quality--life values. utility_range_tox Comma-separated list utility values TOX state sensitivity analysis. Example: "0, 0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 1.0" utility_range_rel Comma-separated list utility values REL state sensitivity analysis. threshold_analysis Find threshold utility values treatment preference changes. Identifies "break-even" points clinical decision-making. confidence_level Confidence level interval estimation (default: 0.95 95\ bootstrap_ciUse bootstrap resampling calculate confidence intervals Q-TWiST treatment differences. Recommended robust inference. bootstrap_samplesNumber bootstrap resamples confidence interval calculation. samples = precise estimates longer computation time. 1000 samples usually sufficient; use 2000+ publication. bootstrap_seedRandom seed bootstrap sampling (reproducibility). stratify_byVariables stratified analysis (e.g., site, stage, biomarker status). Separate Q-TWiST analyses performed stratum. pooled_analysisDisplay overall Q-TWiST results addition stratified results. show_state_partitionDisplay table showing mean time spent health state (TOX, TWiST, REL) treatment arm. show_qtwist_scoresDisplay quality-adjusted survival (Q-TWiST) scores treatment applied utility weights. show_treatment_differenceDisplay Q-TWiST difference treatment arms confidence intervals statistical significance. show_sensitivity_tableDisplay results across varying utility weight combinations. show_rmst_componentsShow underlying restricted mean survival time calculations overall survival progression-free survival. show_descriptive_statsDisplay sample sizes, median survival times, event rates treatment arm. plot_partitioned_survivalDisplay stacked area plot showing TOX, TWiST, REL components time treatment arm. plot_qtwist_comparisonBar chart comparing Q-TWiST components (TOX, TWiST, REL) treatment arms utility weights applied. plot_sensitivityContour plot heatmap showing Q-TWiST treatment difference across varying utility weight combinations. plot_km_curvesDisplay standard Kaplan-Meier survival curves OS PFS reference alongside Q-TWiST results. plot_color_schemeColor scheme partitioned survival plots. TOX (toxicity), TWiST (good quality), REL (relapse) states. showExplanationsInclude detailed explanations Q-TWiST methodology, interpretation guidance, clinical significance. showClinicalGuidanceProvide clinical interpretation assistance including treatment implications decision-making considerations. showFormulasDisplay mathematical formulas Q-TWiST calculations statistical tests. showReferencesDisplay key references Q-TWiST methodology applications. results object containing: TOX: Time treatment toxicity (typically Œº = 0-0.5) TWiST: Time without symptoms toxicity (Œº = 1.0, perfect health) REL: Time disease relapse/progression (typically Œº = 0-0.5) State-based survival partitioning clinical significance Utility weight application quality adjustment Sensitivity analysis across utility values Bootstrap confidence intervals treatment differences Visual comparison partitioned survival plots Adjuvant therapy evaluation (balancing toxicity vs. benefit) Treatment comparison survival similar quality differs Shared decision-making (patient-relevant quality metrics) Regulatory submissions (FDA/EMA recognized endpoint)

title: Rank-based AFT Estimation ‚Äî raftgee
text: Implements rank-based accelerated failure time (AFT) models using generalized estimating equations (GEE) survival data analysis. approach provides robust estimation proportional hazards assumptions violated, offering distribution-free methods modeling survival times emphasis median survival relationships time acceleration effects clinical research applications.

title: Rank-based AFT Estimation ‚Äî raftgee
code: raftgee(   data,   elapsedtime,   outcome,   covariates,   outcomeLevel = "1",   rank_method = "logrank",   correlation_structure = "independence",   cluster_variable,   confidence_level = 0.95,   max_iterations = 100,   convergence_tolerance = 1e-06,   weights_variable,   robust_variance = TRUE,   bootstrap_samples = 0,   show_model_summary = TRUE,   show_coefficients = TRUE,   show_diagnostics = TRUE,   show_residual_plots = TRUE,   show_qq_plots = TRUE,   show_survival_plots = TRUE,   show_acceleration_plots = TRUE,   show_comparison_plots = TRUE,   showSummaries = FALSE,   showExplanations = FALSE )

title: Rank-based AFT Estimation ‚Äî raftgee
text: data data data frame elapsedtime Survival time follow-duration variable outcome Event indicator variable (0/1, FALSE/TRUE, factor) covariates Covariate variables AFT modeling outcomeLevel Level outcome variable indicating event occurrence rank_method Rank-based test method AFT estimation correlation_structure Working correlation structure GEE cluster_variable Variable defining clusters correlated observations confidence_level Confidence level parameter estimates max_iterations Maximum number iterations GEE algorithm convergence_tolerance Convergence tolerance parameter estimation weights_variable Optional weights variable observations robust_variance Use robust sandwich variance estimator bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples variance estimation (0 = bootstrap) show_model_summary Display comprehensive AFT model summary show_coefficients Display AFT model coefficients table show_diagnostics Display model diagnostic statistics show_residual_plots Display residual diagnostic plots show_qq_plots Display quantile-quantile plots show_survival_plots Display AFT-based survival curves show_acceleration_plots Display time acceleration factor plots show_comparison_plots Display comparison Cox models showSummaries Generate natural language summaries analysis results showExplanations Show detailed explanations methodology interpretation

title: Raincloud Plot ‚Äî raincloud
text: Creates Raincloud plots visualize data distributions using ggdist package. Raincloud plots combine three visualization techniques: half-violin plots showing distribution density, box plots showing summary statistics, dot plots showing individual data points. provides comprehensive view data distribution reveals patterns traditional box plots might miss, including multimodality distribution shape. Based ggdist R-Bloggers tutorial.

title: Raincloud Plot ‚Äî raincloud
code: raincloud(   data,   dep_var,   group_var,   facet_var = NULL,   color_var = NULL,   show_violin = TRUE,   show_boxplot = TRUE,   show_dots = TRUE,   dots_side = "left",   violin_width = 0.7,   box_width = 0.2,   dots_size = 1.2,   alpha_violin = 0.7,   alpha_dots = 0.8,   orientation = "horizontal",   color_palette = "clinical",   plot_theme = "clinical",   plot_title = "Raincloud Plot - Distribution Visualization",   x_label = "",   y_label = "",   show_statistics = FALSE,   show_outliers = FALSE,   outlier_method = "iqr",   normality_test = FALSE,   comparison_test = FALSE,   comparison_method = "auto",   adjust_method = "none",   effect_size = FALSE,   log_transform = FALSE )

title: Raincloud Plot ‚Äî raincloud
text: data data data frame. dep_var Continuous variable whose distribution visualized raincloud plot. group_var Categorical variable grouping. group raincloud visualization. facet_var Optional variable creating separate panels. Creates multiple raincloud plots  grid layout. color_var Optional variable coloring different elements. specified, uses grouping variable. show_violin TRUE, displays half-violin plot showing probability density distribution. show_boxplot TRUE, displays box plot median, quartiles, outliers. show_dots TRUE, displays individual data points dots. dots_side Position data point dots relative violin plot. violin_width Width scaling factor violin plot component. box_width Width box plot component. dots_size Size individual data point dots. alpha_violin Transparency level violin plot (0 = transparent, 1 = opaque). alpha_dots Transparency level data point dots. orientation Orientation plot. Horizontal creates classic "raincloud" appearance. color_palette Color palette different groups including GraphPad Prism palettes. plot_theme Overall visual theme plot. plot_title Custom title raincloud plot. x_label Custom label X-axis. empty, uses variable name. y_label Custom label Y-axis. empty, uses variable name. show_statistics TRUE, displays summary statistics table group. show_outliers TRUE, identifies highlights outliers visualization. outlier_method Method detecting outliers highlight outliers enabled. normality_test TRUE, performs normality tests (Shapiro-Wilk) group. comparison_test TRUE, performs statistical tests compare groups. comparison_method Statistical test method comparing groups. adjust_method Adjustment method applied reported p-value (useful multiple comparisons). effect_size TRUE two groups present, reports Cohen's d effect size. log_transform Apply log10 transformation Y-axis (requires positive values).

title: Model Reclassification Metrics (NRI & IDI) ‚Äî reclassmetrics
text: Calculate reclassification metrics compare predictive performance two models. Provides Net Reclassification Improvement (NRI), Integrated Discrimination Improvement (IDI), related metrics binary survival outcomes. Essential demonstrating incremental value new biomarkers predictors.

title: Model Reclassification Metrics (NRI & IDI) ‚Äî reclassmetrics
code: reclassmetrics(   data,   outcome,   outcomeType = "binary",   survivalTime,   timePoint = 60,   oldModelProb,   newModelProb,   riskCategories = "0.0,0.1,0.2,1.0",   nriType = "both",   ciLevel = 0.95,   bootstrapCI = TRUE,   nBootstrap = 500,   showReclassTable = TRUE,   showEventNonEvent = TRUE,   showIDIComponents = TRUE,   showCalibrationComparison = TRUE )

title: Model Reclassification Metrics (NRI & IDI) ‚Äî reclassmetrics
text: data data data frame. outcome Binary outcome (binary analysis) event indicator (survival). outcomeType Type outcome variable. survivalTime Time event censoring (months) survival analysis. timePoint Time point (months) evaluate survival predictions. oldModelProb Predicted probabilities survival probabilities baseline model. newModelProb Predicted probabilities survival probabilities enhanced model. riskCategories Comma-separated risk thresholds categorical NRI (e.g., "0.0,0.1,0.2,1.0" low/medium/high risk groups). nriType Type NRI calculation. ciLevel Confidence level intervals (0.80-0.99). bootstrapCI Use bootstrap resampling confidence intervals (recommended). nBootstrap Number bootstrap samples confidence intervals. showReclassTable Display cross-tabulation risk category changes. showEventNonEvent Display NRI components separately events non-events. showIDIComponents Display integrated sensitivity 1-specificity improvements. showCalibrationComparison Compare calibration old new models.

title: Model Reclassification Metrics (NRI & IDI) ‚Äî reclassmetrics

title: Enhanced Frequencies ‚Äî reportcat2
text: data data data frame containing categorical variables analyzed.  data frame least one row specified variables  exist dataset. vars character vector specifying variable names summarize. variables  automatically converted factors already. Character,  numeric, logical variables acceptable treated categorical. sumvar_style Logical (default: FALSE). TRUE, provides comprehensive categorical analysis  similar sumvar package's tab1() function, including enhanced frequency  tables, percentage breakdowns, cumulative statistics category. show_proportions Logical (default: TRUE). TRUE, displays cumulative counts percentages  alongside individual category statistics using sumvar_style format.  Ignored sumvar_style FALSE. sort_by_frequency Logical (default: FALSE). TRUE, categories within variable sorted  frequency (common first) rather alphabetically. applies  output formats.

title: Find Retracted Papers from DOI ‚Äî retracted
text: Checks DOIs retraction databases identify retracted publications. Uses OpenRetractions API validate publication status can optionally retrieve PubMed IDs. Includes DOI format validation, rate limiting,  robust error handling reliable results.

title: Find Retracted Papers from DOI ‚Äî retracted
code: retracted(data, doi, database = "or", pmid = FALSE)

title: Find Retracted Papers from DOI ‚Äî retracted
text: data data data frame containing DOI variable check. Must least one column DOI strings. doi Column containing DOI strings check retractions. Supports multiple DOI formats including bare DOIs (10.1000/example),  DOI URIs (doi:10.1000/example), DOI URLs (https://doi.org/10.1000/example). database Database check retractions. OpenRetractions recommended  provides comprehensive --date retraction information.  RetractionWatch option currently uses OpenRetractions fallback. pmid TRUE, attempts retrieve corresponding PubMed IDs valid DOIs using rcrossref package. Requires internet connection may  increase processing time large datasets.

title: Find Retracted Papers from DOI ‚Äî retracted

title: River Plots & Alluvial Diagrams ‚Äî riverplot
text: Creates comprehensive river plots, alluvial diagrams, stream charts visualize flows, transitions, temporal changes categorical data. Supports individual entity tracking, aggregate trends, multi-stage pathways. Perfect patient journeys, treatment progressions, categorical changes time, flow analysis.

title: River Plots & Alluvial Diagrams ‚Äî riverplot
code: riverplot(   data,   id = NULL,   time = NULL,   strata = list(),   weight = NULL,   plotType = "alluvial",   fillType = "first",   dataFormat = "auto",   sortStreams = TRUE,   labelNodes = TRUE,   curveType = "cubic",   showCounts = FALSE,   showPercentages = FALSE,   showLegend = TRUE,   legendPosition = "right",   colorScheme = "default",   customColors = "",   nodeWidth = 0.1,   nodeGap = 0.05,   flowAlpha = 0.7,   mytitle = "",   xtitle = "",   ytitle = "",   originaltheme = FALSE,   fontSize = 12,   plotWidth = 10,   plotHeight = 8,   enableDiagnostics = FALSE,   edgeGradient = TRUE,   nodeStyle = "regular",   edgeStyle = "gradient",   gravity = "center",   addMidPoints = FALSE,   reorderEdges = FALSE,   curveGranularity = 100,   backgroundLabels = FALSE,   exportRiverplotObject = FALSE,   clinicalPreset = "none",   smart_detection = TRUE,   enhanced_validation = TRUE,   multi_format_support = FALSE,   adaptive_styling = TRUE,   quality_optimization = FALSE,   cross_reference_mode = FALSE,   high_contrast_mode = FALSE,   large_dataset_mode = FALSE,   enable_caching = TRUE,   detailed_progress = FALSE )

title: River Plots & Alluvial Diagrams ‚Äî riverplot
text: data data data frame. id Optional identifier tracking individual entities (patients, cases, customers) transitions. Required individual-level flow tracking. Leave empty aggregate flow visualization. time Variable representing time points sequential stages (visit dates, follow-periods, sequential stages). Required longitudinal data single strata variable. Leave empty using wide format data multiple strata variables. strata Variables containing categories flow stages. longitudinal data: single variable categories (treatment_response, disease_stage).  wide format: multiple variables representing sequential stages  (baseline_status, month3_status, month6_status). factor meaningful category names. weight Optional numerical variable determine flow width proportional values. Examples: patient count, cost, severity score, revenue. provided, flows represent equal counts/frequencies. Use emphasizing quantitative importance different pathways. plotType Type flow visualization. 'alluvial' creates flowing streams curved connections, ideal transitions. 'sankey' creates directed flow diagrams  straighter connections, good process flows. 'stream' shows aggregate category trends time. 'flow' tracks individual entities time periods. fillType Determines colors assigned flows. 'first' colors flows based initial category (tracking origins). 'last' colors final category  (tracking destinations). 'frequency' uses flow volume colors (emphasizes major pathways). dataFormat Format input data. 'long' format rows time point single strata variable. 'wide' format multiple strata variables columns representing different stages. 'auto' detects format based variables provided. sortStreams Sort alluvial streams frequency/size. Larger flows positioned prominently, making major pathways easier identify. Recommended highlighting dominant patterns. labelNodes Display category labels nodes (vertical bars). Labels identify segment represents. Recommended unless space limited labels overlap. curveType Shape connecting curves stages. 'cardinal' creates smooth flowing curves (aesthetic). 'sin' creates sinusoidal curves (CRAN riverplot style). 'riverplot' uses advanced curve generation CRAN riverplot package. showCounts Display numerical counts values nodes. Shows exact frequencies sums category stage. Useful precise interpretation may clutter visualization many categories. showPercentages Display percentages nodes flows. Shows relative proportions within stage flow. Complement absolute counts better interpretation. showLegend Display color legend explaining category mappings. Recommended colors represent meaningful categories. Can hidden save space category labels clearly visible. legendPosition Position color legend relative plot. colorScheme Color palette categories. Choose based data type aesthetic preference. customColors Comma-separated hex colors custom color scheme (e.g., "#1f77b4,#ff7f0e,#2ca02c"). used Color Scheme set 'Custom'. nodeWidth Width nodes (vertical bars) proportion plot width. Adjust better balance nodes flows. nodeGap Gap categories within node proportion node height. Smaller values create compact nodes. flowAlpha Transparency flow connections (0 = fully transparent, 1 = opaque). Lower values help see overlapping flows. mytitle Main title plot. Leave empty title. xtitle Label x-axis (time/stage axis). Leave empty default label. ytitle Label y-axis (frequency/count axis). Leave empty default label. originaltheme Use original ggalluvial package theme instead minimal theme. May provide better default styling plot types. fontSize Base font size labels text plot. plotWidth Width plot inches export. plotHeight Height plot inches export. enableDiagnostics Display diagnostic information data processing, flow calculations, potential issues. Useful troubleshooting complex datasets. edgeGradient Apply color gradients edges smoother visual transitions. Based CRAN riverplot package gradient capabilities. nodeStyle Visual style nodes. 'regular' shows filled rectangles, 'point' shows small circles, 'invisible' hides nodes maintains connections. edgeStyle Visual style edges. 'gradient' creates smooth color transitions, 'sin' varies edge thickness sinusoidally aesthetic effect. gravity Vertical alignment strategy nodes within stage. Affects nodes positioned relative . addMidPoints Add intermediate invisible nodes create smoother edge paths. Helps reduce edge crossings improve visual clarity (CRAN riverplot feature). reorderEdges Automatically attempt disentangle optimize edge routing reduce crossings. Uses algorithms CRAN riverplot package. curveGranularity Number points used generate smooth curves. Higher values create smoother curves increase rendering time. backgroundLabels Add background boxes labels better readability, similar CRAN riverplot's bglabel functionality. exportRiverplotObject Create display riverplot-compatible object structure use CRAN riverplot package. clinicalPreset Apply predefined configurations optimized common clinical scenarios. preset automatically configures plot type, styling, display options selected clinical use case. smart_detection Automatically detect optimal data format analysis approach based provided variables. enhanced_validation Apply comprehensive data validation user-friendly error messages suggestions. multi_format_support Enable experimental support additional data formats (source-target, multi-node). adaptive_styling Automatically adapt plot styling based data characteristics size. quality_optimization Apply advanced algorithms optimize flow layout, reduce crossings, improve readability. cross_reference_mode Show suggestions alluvial function might appropriate data. high_contrast_mode Enable high contrast colors larger fonts better accessibility readability. large_dataset_mode Enable memory-efficient processing datasets >10,000 observations. May reduce rendering detail performance. enable_caching Cache computation results improve performance repeated analysis data. detailed_progress Show detailed progress information long-running operations. Useful large datasets.

title: Two-Dimensional ROC Analysis ‚Äî roc2d
text: Two-dimensional ROC analysis evaluating diagnostic accuracy dual biomarker combinations multi-parametric tests. two biomarkers measured simultaneously (e.g., ER PR breast cancer, dual IHC markers, imaging plus biomarker), 2D ROC analysis finds optimal combined decision rule two-dimensional marker space. Unlike analyzing markers separately combining results, 2D ROC jointly optimizes thresholds maximize diagnostic accuracy. Provides joint sensitivity/specificity, optimal threshold pairs, 3D ROC surface visualization, comparison single-marker performance. Essential multiplex assays, dual biomarker panels, situations neither marker alone sufficient combination improves diagnosis. Applications include ER/PR combinations, dual IHC (e.g., p16/Ki67), imaging radiomics plus molecular markers, scenario two continuous diagnostic measurements.

title: Two-Dimensional ROC Analysis ‚Äî roc2d

title: ROC Regression (Covariate-Adjusted ROC) ‚Äî rocreg
text: ROC regression covariate-adjusted diagnostic accuracy assessment. Traditional ROC analysis assumes diagnostic test performance constant across patients, accuracy often varies patient characteristics (age, disease stage, scanner type, staining protocol). ROC regression models sensitivity specificity change functions covariates, providing covariate-specific ROC curves adjusted summary measures (covariate-adjusted AUC). Essential comparing diagnostic tests across heterogeneous populations, adjusting confounders test comparison studies, identifying patient subgroups tests perform differently. Particularly valuable digital pathology accounting batch effects (different scanners, institutions, staining protocols) biomarker studies age/stage-specific performance assessment. Uses binormal, non-parametric, Bayesian approaches model covariate effects ROC curves. Provides population-averaged covariate-specific diagnostic accuracy estimates.

title: ROC Regression (Covariate-Adjusted ROC) ‚Äî rocreg
code: rocreg(   data,   predictor,   outcome,   positive_level,   covariates,   covariate_effects = "both",   method = "binormal",   adjusted_auc = TRUE,   covariate_specific_auc = TRUE,   covariate_profiles = "",   compare_unadjusted = TRUE,   test_covariate_effects = TRUE,   variable_selection = FALSE,   selection_criterion = "aic",   test_interactions = FALSE,   confidence_intervals = TRUE,   ci_method = "bootstrap",   bootstrap_samples = 500,   confidence_level = 0.95,   plot_covariate_specific_rocs = TRUE,   plot_auc_by_covariate = TRUE,   plot_effect_estimates = TRUE,   plot_residual_diagnostics = FALSE,   adjustment_purpose = "confounder",   clinical_application = "general",   show_interpretation = TRUE,   standardize_covariates = TRUE,   missing_handling = "complete",   random_seed = 123 )

title: ROC Regression (Covariate-Adjusted ROC) ‚Äî rocreg
text: data data data frame. predictor Continuous diagnostic test variable (biomarker level, imaging score, AI probability). test whose accuracy varies covariates. outcome Binary outcome variable (diseased vs non-diseased, positive vs negative). positive_level level represents diseased/positive state. covariates Variables may affect diagnostic accuracy. Examples: age, sex, disease stage, scanner type, institution, staining batch. continuous categorical covariates supported. covariate_effects model covariate effects. "" allows different effects diseased non-diseased groups, "sensitivity" models effects diseased, "specificity" non-diseased. method Method ROC regression. Binormal assumes normal distributions covariate effects location/scale, non-parametric uses kernel smoothing, semi-parametric combines , Bayesian provides posterior distributions. adjusted_auc Calculate population-averaged AUC adjusted covariates. overall AUC accounting covariate distribution population. covariate_specific_auc Calculate AUC specific covariate values show diagnostic accuracy varies across patient characteristics. covariate_profiles Specify covariate values covariate-specific ROC curves. Example age: "30, 50, 70" get curves young/middle/elderly patients. Leave empty automatic selection (quartiles continuous, levels categorical). compare_unadjusted Show comparison covariate-adjusted unadjusted (pooled) ROC analysis. Demonstrates impact covariate adjustment. test_covariate_effects Perform statistical tests determine covariates significantly affect diagnostic accuracy. Likelihood ratio tests Wald tests depending method. variable_selection Use stepwise information criteria select covariates include final model. Helpful many potential confounders. selection_criterion Criterion automatic variable selection. test_interactions Test interactions covariates (e.g., age effect differ sex? scanner effect vary institution?). confidence_intervals Calculate confidence intervals covariate-adjusted AUC ROC curves. ci_method Method confidence interval estimation. Bootstrap recommended small samples non-parametric methods. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples CI estimation. confidence_level Confidence level intervals. plot_covariate_specific_rocs Display multiple ROC curves different covariate profiles plot. Shows ROC curve changes patient characteristics. plot_auc_by_covariate continuous covariates, plot AUC changes covariate varies. Shows non-linear relationships covariates diagnostic accuracy. plot_effect_estimates Forest plot showing estimated covariate effects diagnostic accuracy confidence intervals. plot_residual_diagnostics Display residual plots goodness--fit diagnostics ROC regression model. adjustment_purpose Purpose covariate adjustment interpretation guidance. clinical_application Clinical application context interpretation. show_interpretation Provide interpretation clinical context recommendations. standardize_covariates Standardize continuous covariates (mean 0, SD better numerical stability interpretability effect sizes. missing_handling Method handling missing covariate data. random_seed Random seed bootstrap stochastic procedures.

title: Segmentation Metrics (Dice, IoU, Hausdorff) ‚Äî segmentationmetrics
text: data data data frame. prediction_mask AI-predicted segmentation mask. binary segmentation, binary variable (0/1 background/foreground). multi-class, contains class labels. Can pixel-level region-level data. ground_truth_mask Expert-annotated ground truth segmentation mask. Must encoding scheme prediction_mask. image_id Variable identifying individual images regions. Used aggregate metrics per image calculate summary statistics across images. segmentation_type Type segmentation task. Binary single structure (e.g., tumor vs background), multi-class multiple tissue types (e.g., epithelium/stroma/necrosis), instance individual object detection (e.g., separate cell nuclei). positive_class binary segmentation, specify level represents foreground/ structure interest (e.g., tumor, gland, nucleus). dice_coefficient Calculate Dice coefficient (also known F1-score segmentation). Measures spatial overlap: Dice = 2|‚à©B| / (||+|B|). Range 0-1, 1 = perfect overlap. commonly used segmentation metric. jaccard_index Calculate Jaccard Index (Intersection Union). Measures overlap: IoU = |‚à©B| / |‚à™B|. Range 0-1. Related Dice: IoU = Dice/(2-Dice). Standard metric computer vision AI segmentation. volumetric_similarity Calculate Volumetric Similarity coefficient 3D segmentation area-based similarity 2D. Useful volume/area preservation analysis. sensitivity_specificity Calculate pixel-wise sensitivity (true positive rate) specificity (true negative rate). Shows -segmentation vs -segmentation. hausdorff_distance Calculate Hausdorff Distance - maximum distance predicted boundary ground truth boundary. Sensitive outliers. Measures worst-case boundary error. Reported pixels mm pixel size provided. average_hausdorff Calculate Average Hausdorff Distance (95th percentile). robust outliers maximum Hausdorff. Better represents typical boundary error. surface_distance Calculate average distance predicted ground truth boundaries. Mean point--surface distances. Provides average boundary error. surface_overlap Calculate Surface Dice (boundary-focused Dice). considers points near boundaries. Emphasizes boundary accuracy volume accuracy. boundary_tolerance Tolerance distance surface/boundary metrics pixels. Points within distance considered boundary points. Typical: 1-5 pixels depending magnification. pixel_size_provided Whether pixel/voxel physical dimensions available converting pixel-based metrics physical distances (micrometers, millimeters). pixel_size_x Physical size one pixel X dimension (micrometers). Used convert pixel-based distances micrometers. Typical WSI: 0.25-0.5 Œºm/pixel. pixel_size_y Physical size one pixel Y dimension (micrometers). class_specific_metrics multi-class segmentation, calculate metrics separately class (one-vs-rest approach). Shows performance per tissue type. macro_average Calculate macro-average (unweighted mean) metrics across classes. Treats classes equally regardless size. weighted_average Calculate weighted average metrics, weighted class prevalence/size. Emphasizes performance larger structures. object_detection_metrics instance segmentation, calculate object-level detection metrics: precision, recall, F1-score based IoU threshold matching objects. iou_threshold Minimum IoU predicted ground truth objects consider matched. Standard: 0.5 object detection, 0.7 strict matching. count_metrics Calculate object counting accuracy instance segmentation (e.g., cell count accuracy, absolute/relative counting error). confidence_intervals Calculate confidence intervals metrics across images using bootstrap normal approximation. bootstrap_ci Use bootstrap resampling confidence intervals instead normal approximation. accurate small sample sizes skewed distributions. bootstrap_samples Number bootstrap samples confidence interval estimation. confidence_level Confidence level interval estimation (default 95\ quality_thresholdsApply clinical quality thresholds categorize segmentation performance (excellent/good/acceptable/poor) based Dice/IoU values. dice_threshold_excellentDice coefficient threshold "excellent" segmentation quality. Typical: ‚â•0.90 clinical deployment. dice_threshold_goodDice coefficient threshold "good" segmentation quality. dice_threshold_acceptableDice coefficient threshold minimally "acceptable" segmentation. may require human review. stratified_analysisPerform stratified analysis image characteristics (scanner, magnification, staining protocol, tissue type) assess consistency. stratify_byVariable stratified analysis (e.g., scanner_type, magnification, stain). outlier_detectionDetect outlier images unusually poor segmentation performance. Flags images requiring expert review. outlier_methodMethod outlier detection across images. plot_metric_distributionPlot distribution metrics across images (histogram/violin plot). Shows variability segmentation quality. plot_scatter_comparisonScatter plot showing relationship Dice IoU across images. plot_boundary_errorPlot Hausdorff surface distances visualize boundary accuracy. plot_confusion_matrixFor multi-class segmentation, show confusion matrix pixel classifications. plot_performance_by_classBar plot showing metrics class multi-class segmentation. application_contextClinical/research application context interpretation guidance. show_interpretationProvide interpretation results including recommendations clinical deployment based performance metrics. paired_analysisPerform paired statistical tests comparing segmentation performance different AI models methods images. comparison_methodVariable identifying different segmentation methods comparison. missing_handlingHow handle images missing incomplete segmentations. random_seedRandom seed bootstrap sampling stochastic procedures. results object containing:

title: Simon-Makuch Time-Dependent Survival Analysis ‚Äî simonmakuch
text: Performs comprehensive survival analysis time-dependent variables using Simon-Makuch method. specialized analysis addresses critical challenge immortal time bias studying treatments, biomarkers, exposures change patient follow-. Clinical Applications: - Treatment effectiveness therapy timing varies (e.g., adjuvant therapy, targeted agents) - Biomarker evolution studies (e.g., mutation status, protein expression changes) - Disease progression impact outcomes (e.g., metastasis development, grade progression) - Healthcare intervention timing effects (e.g., surgery, radiation, supportive care) Key Statistical Methods: - Simon-Makuch plots: Modified Kaplan-Meier curves time-dependent exposures - Landmark analysis: Conditional survival fixed time points - Time-dependent Cox regression: Hazard ratios accounting exposure timing - Immortal time bias assessment: Comparison naive vs. proper methods - Mantel-Byar testing: Specialized tests time-dependent comparisons Use Simon-Makuch Analysis: Standard survival analysis assumes fixed baseline characteristics, leading immortal time bias exposures change follow-. Simon-Makuch methods properly account timing exposure changes, providing unbiased survival estimates valid statistical comparisons.

title: Simon-Makuch Time-Dependent Survival Analysis ‚Äî simonmakuch

title: Simple Tumor Marker and Cancer Progression Data ‚Äî simple_cancer_data
code: data(simple_cancer_data)  # Basic joint modeling analysis library(ggplot2)  # Marker trajectories by treatment ggplot(simple_cancer_data, aes(x = visit_time, y = tumor_marker, color = treatment)) +   geom_smooth(method = "loess") +   labs(title = "Tumor Marker by Treatment",         x = "Time (months)", y = "Tumor Marker") #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'   # Individual trajectories for first 20 patients first_20 <- subset(simple_cancer_data, patient_id %in% unique(patient_id)[1:20]) ggplot(first_20, aes(x = visit_time, y = tumor_marker, group = patient_id)) +   geom_line(alpha = 0.7) + geom_point(alpha = 0.5) +   facet_wrap(~treatment) +   labs(title = "Individual Tumor Marker Trajectories")

title: Single Arm Survival ‚Äî singlearm
text: data data data frame. elapsedtime time--event follow-duration patient. sum values represents total person-time follow-study, serves denominator calculating event rates fundamental Kaplan-Meier estimates. numeric continuous, measured consistent units (e.g., months years). tint Enable option want calculate survival time dates data. useful separate columns diagnosis date follow-date want calculate time elapsed . dxdate date diagnosis study entry. Accepts: (1) Date/datetime text (e.g., "2024-01-15"), (2) Numeric Unix epoch seconds (DateTime Converter's corrected_datetime_numeric output), (3) Numeric datetime values R. Time intervals calculated difference follow-date. fudate date last follow-event. Accepts: (1) Date/datetime text (e.g., "2024-01-15"), (2) Numeric Unix epoch seconds (DateTime Converter's corrected_datetime_numeric output), (3) Numeric datetime values R. Must format diagnosis date. outcome outcome event interest patient. factor numeric variable indicating whether patient experienced event (e.g., death) censoring (e.g., end follow-). outcomeLevel Select level outcome variable represents event interest. example, outcome variable "death_status" levels "Alive" "Dead", select "Dead" event level. dod Select level outcome variable represents death due disease. useful competing risk analysis multiple event types. dooc Select level outcome variable represents death due causes. useful competing risk analysis multiple event types. awd Select level outcome variable represents alive disease. useful competing risk analysis multiple event types. awod Select level outcome variable represents alive without disease. useful competing risk analysis multiple event types. analysistype Select type survival analysis perform. "Overall" analyzes survival patients regardless event type. "Cause Specific" analyzes survival specific event type (e.g., death due disease). "Competing Risk" analyzes survival multiple event types simultaneously. cutp Specify time points calculate survival probabilities. Enter comma-separated list time points consistent units (e.g., months years). example, "12, 36, 60" calculates survival probabilities 1, 3, 5 years. timetypedata select time type data (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD) timetypeoutput Select time unit displaying survival results. Months common  clinical oncology studies. Choose unit best matches clinical  practice makes results interpretable audience. uselandmark Enables landmark analysis, addresses immortal time bias analyzing survival patients survive specified timepoint (landmark). Use want eliminate effect early deaths comparing treatments can given patients survive long enough receive . landmark Enables landmark analysis, addresses immortal time bias analyzing survival patients survive specified timepoint (landmark). Use want eliminate effect early deaths comparing treatments can given patients survive long enough receive . sc Enable option generate Kaplan-Meier survival plot confidence intervals. plot shows estimated survival probability time useful visualizing survival trends data. kmunicate Enable option generate publication-ready survival plot style KMunicate. plot shows estimated survival probability time confidence intervals suitable publication presentation. ce Enable option calculate plot cumulative number events time. plot shows total number events (e.g., deaths) occurred time point useful visualizing event rates data. ch Enable option calculate plot cumulative hazard function time. plot shows cumulative risk experiencing event (e.g., death) time point useful visualizing risk event time. endplot maximum time point include survival plots. end time survival curves cumulative event/hazard plots. Enter positive integer representing time consistent units (e.g., months years). ybegin_plot minimum value y-axis survival plots. Enter number 0 1 set lower limit y-axis. yend_plot maximum value y-axis survival plots. Enter number 0 1 set upper limit y-axis. byplot interval plotting survival probabilities. Enter positive integer representing time interval consistent units (e.g., months years). multievent Enable option perform survival analysis datasets multiple event levels. useful competing risk analysis multiple event types (e.g., death due disease, death due causes). ci95 Enable option display 95\ survival plots. intervals show range uncertainty around estimated survival probabilities useful assessing precision estimates. risktable Enable option display table risk estimates time point. table shows estimated survival probability, cumulative event rate, cumulative hazard time point useful summarizing survival characteristics data. censored Enable option display censored observations survival plots. Censored observations patients experienced event interest end follow-indicated vertical ticks survival curves. medianline true, displays line indicating median survival time survival plot. person_time Enable option calculate display person-time metrics, including total follow-time incidence rates. metrics help quantify rate events per unit time study population. time_intervals Specify time intervals stratified person-time analysis. Enter  comma-separated list time points create intervals. example,  "12, 36, 60" create intervals 0-12, 12-36, 36-60, 60+. rate_multiplier Specify multiplier incidence rates (e.g., 100 rates per 100 person-years, 1000 rates per 1000 person-years). baseline_hazard Estimate plot baseline hazard function assess instantaneous risk events changes time study population. hazard_smoothing Generate smoothed hazard rate estimates better visualize patterns event risk time assess proportional hazards assumptions. showExplanations Display detailed explanations analysis component help interpret statistical methods results. showSummaries Display natural language summaries alongside tables plots. summaries provide plain-language interpretations statistical results. Turn reduce visual clutter summaries needed. advancedDiagnostics Enable advanced diagnostic features including enhanced data quality  assessment, performance optimizations caching, improved error  reporting. provides additional insights data reliability  analysis quality without affecting core results.

Can continuous categorical. grvar Optional grouping variable creating grouped plots across multiple panels. direction Measurement design type. "independent" -subjects comparisons,  "repeated" within-subjects/repeated measures comparisons. distribution Statistical approach: "p" = parametric, "np" = nonparametric,  "r" = robust, "bf" = Bayes factor. alluvsty Style alluvial diagrams: "t1" = ggalluvial stratum labels,  "t2" = easyalluvial automatic variable selection. excl TRUE, excludes rows missing values analysis. sampleLarge TRUE, automatically samples large datasets (>10,000 rows) 5,000 rows improved performance.

title: Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology
code: stereology(   data,   intersections,   totalPoints,   boundaryIntersections = NULL,   objectCount = NULL,   referenceArea,   sectionThickness = 5,   gridSpacing,   tissueType = "vessels",   groupVar = NULL,   calculateAa = TRUE,   calculateVv = TRUE,   calculateBa = FALSE,   calculateNa = FALSE,   calculateSv = FALSE,   showConfidenceIntervals = TRUE,   bootstrapIterations = 1000,   showGroupComparison = FALSE,   showDescriptives = TRUE,   showPlot = TRUE,   plotType = "bars",   showMethodology = TRUE,   showReferences = FALSE )

title: Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology
text: data . intersections Number grid intersections (hits) structure interest (e.g., vessels, nuclei, fibrosis areas). totalPoints Total number grid points test lines used measurement. boundaryIntersections Number grid line intersections object boundaries (boundary density calculation). objectCount Number discrete objects counted (numerical density calculation). referenceArea Total reference area examined (square micrometers). Typically calculated : image width √ó height. sectionThickness Histological section thickness micrometers. Required volume density calculations. Default: 5 Œºm. gridSpacing Distance grid lines micrometers. Used length calculations boundary/surface density. tissueType Type tissue structure quantified. helps provide context-specific interpretation. groupVar Optional grouping variable compare stereology parameters across groups (e.g., diagnosis, treatment, grade). calculateAa Area density: proportion reference area occupied structure. Formula: Aa = intersection count / total points. calculateVv Volume density: proportion reference volume occupied structure. isotropic sections, Vv = Aa. calculateBa Boundary density: boundary length per unit area. Requires boundary intersection data. calculateNa Numerical density: number objects per unit area. Requires object count data. calculateSv Surface density: surface area per unit volume. Formula: Sv = 2 √ó Ba (isotropic sections). showConfidenceIntervals Calculate display 95\ intervals stereological estimates using bootstrap methods. bootstrapIterations Number bootstrap iterations confidence interval estimation. showGroupComparison Compare stereological parameters across groups (requires grouping variable). showDescriptives . showPlot Display bar chart stereological parameters confidence intervals. plotType . showMethodology Display detailed explanation stereological methods, formulas, interpretation guidelines. showReferences Display literature references stereological methods.

title: Example Vessel Density Data for Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology_vessel_data
code: stereology_vessel_data

title: Example Vessel Density Data for Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology_vessel_data
text: data frame 50 observations 13 variables: image_id Character. Unique image identifier diagnosis Factor. Diagnosis group (Normal, Benign, Malignant) tissue_type Character. Type structure quantified (Blood Vessels) intersections Integer. Number grid intersections vessels total_points Integer. Total number grid points examined (100) boundary_intersections Integer. Grid line intersections vessel boundaries object_count Integer. Number discrete vessels counted reference_area Numeric. Total reference area examined (Œºm¬≤) grid_spacing Numeric. Distance grid lines (Œºm) section_thickness Numeric. Histological section thickness (Œºm) Aa Numeric. Calculated area density (fraction) Vv Numeric. Calculated volume density (fraction)

title: Example Vessel Density Data for Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology_vessel_data
text: Simulated data based stereology principles : Kayser et al. (2009) Diagnostic Pathology 4:6. Realistic vessel density values based published tumor angiogenesis studies.

title: Example Vessel Density Data for Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology_vessel_data
text: Study Design: 50 histological images 3 diagnostic groups Systematic 10√ó10 grid overlay (100 points per image) Grid spacing: 10 Œºm Reference area: 1000√ó1000 Œºm (1 mm¬≤) Section thickness: 5 Œºm (standard histology) Clinical Context: Vessel density critical parameter tumor pathology. Malignant tumors often show increased angiogenesis (new blood vessel formation) support rapid growth. Stereology provides unbiased quantification vessel density 2D histological sections without requiring 3D reconstruction. Vessel Density Diagnosis: Normal tissue: Low vessel density (Aa ~ 0.05-0.10) Benign tumors: Moderate vessel density (Aa ~ 0.15-0.25) Malignant tumors: High vessel density (Aa ~ 0.30-0.50) due angiogenesis Stereological Parameters: Area Density (Aa) Formula: Aa = intersections / total_points Meaning: Fraction tissue area occupied vessels Use: Primary measure vessel density Volume Density (Vv) Formula: Vv = Aa (isotropic random sections) Meaning: Fraction tissue volume occupied vessels Use: 3D estimate 2D sections Boundary Density (Ba) Formula: Ba = (2 √ó boundary_intersections) / line_length Meaning: Vessel boundary length per unit area Use: Measure vessel complexity Numerical Density (Na) Formula: Na = object_count / reference_area Meaning: Number vessels per unit area Use: Vessel count density Surface Density (Sv) Formula: Sv = 2 √ó Ba Meaning: Vessel surface area per unit volume Use: Exchange surface quantification Example Analysis: Stereology Needed: Provides unbiased estimates 3D parameters 2D sections need complex 3D reconstruction Well-established statistical properties Reproducible across laboratories Applicable histological structure Expected Results: Malignant tumors show significantly higher vessel density (Aa ~ 0.39) Benign tumors intermediate density (Aa ~ 0.20) Normal tissue lowest density (Aa ~ 0.07) Statistical tests show significant differences groups Quality Control: Grid spacing appropriate vessel size (10 Œºm) Adequate number points per image (100 points) Multiple images per diagnosis (16-17 per group) Systematic random sampling approach
code: # Load data data(stereology_vessel_data, package = "ClinicoPath")  # Basic stereology analysis stereology(   data = stereology_vessel_data,   intersections = 'intersections',   totalPoints = 'total_points',   referenceArea = 'reference_area',   gridSpacing = 'grid_spacing',   calculateAa = TRUE,   calculateVv = TRUE,   showConfidenceIntervals = TRUE )  # Group comparison by diagnosis stereology(   data = stereology_vessel_data,   intersections = 'intersections',   totalPoints = 'total_points',   referenceArea = 'reference_area',   gridSpacing = 'grid_spacing',   groupVar = 'diagnosis',   showGroupComparison = TRUE )  # Advanced analysis with all parameters stereology(   data = stereology_vessel_data,   intersections = 'intersections',   totalPoints = 'total_points',   boundaryIntersections = 'boundary_intersections',   objectCount = 'object_count',   referenceArea = 'reference_area',   gridSpacing = 'grid_spacing',   tissueType = 'vessels',   calculateAa = TRUE,   calculateVv = TRUE,   calculateBa = TRUE,   calculateNa = TRUE,   calculateSv = TRUE,   showConfidenceIntervals = TRUE,   bootstrapIterations = 1000 )

title: Example Vessel Density Data for Stereology Analysis ‚Äî stereology_vessel_data
code: # \donttest{ # Load data data(stereology_vessel_data, package = "ClinicoPath")  # Summary by diagnosis aggregate(Aa ~ diagnosis, data = stereology_vessel_data,           FUN = function(x) c(mean = mean(x), sd = sd(x))) #>   diagnosis    Aa.mean      Aa.sd #> 1    Normal 0.07352941 0.02422323 #> 2    Benign 0.20411765 0.02693947 #> 3 Malignant 0.39375000 0.08754999  # Visualize vessel density distribution boxplot(Aa ~ diagnosis, data = stereology_vessel_data,         main = "Vessel Area Density by Diagnosis",         xlab = "Diagnosis", ylab = "Area Density (Aa)",         col = c("lightblue", "lightgreen", "lightcoral"))   # Test for differences summary(aov(Aa ~ diagnosis, data = stereology_vessel_data)) #>             Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)     #> diagnosis    2  0.852  0.4260   147.3 <2e-16 *** #> Residuals   47  0.136  0.0029                    #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‚Äò***‚Äô 0.001 ‚Äò**‚Äô 0.01 ‚Äò*‚Äô 0.05 ‚Äò.‚Äô 0.1 ‚Äò ‚Äô 1 # }

title: Study Diagram ‚Äî studydiagram
text: data data data frame. data_format data structured. Step summary: one row per study step participant counts. Exclusion mapping: map exclusion reasons specific study steps. diagram_type Rendering engine diagram style. CONSORT clinical trials, Flowchart general study flows. Standard uses DiagrammeR, ggplot2 uses modern styling. participant_id Variable identifying individual participants (participant tracking format) step_excluded Variable indicating step number participant excluded (participant tracking format) exclusion_reason_participant Variable containing exclusion reason text (participant tracking format) step_name Variable containing step/stage names (step summary format) participant_count Variable containing participant counts step (step summary format) exclusion_reason_summary Variable containing exclusion reason descriptions (step summary format) participant_id_mapping Variable identifying individual participants (exclusion mapping format) exclusion_reason_mapping Variable containing exclusion reasons (exclusion mapping format) exclusions_after_step1 Select exclusion reasons occur step 1 (reducing participants step 1 step 2). exclusions shown transition step 1 step 2. exclusions_after_step2 Select exclusion reasons occur step 2 (reducing participants step 2 step 3). exclusions shown transition step 2 step 3. exclusions_after_step3 Select exclusion reasons occur step 3 (reducing participants step 3 step 4). exclusions shown transition step 3 step 4. exclusions_after_step4 Select exclusion reasons occur step 4 (reducing participants step 4 step 5). exclusions shown transition step 4 step 5. exclusions_after_step5 Select exclusion reasons occur step 5 (applicable) step1_label Label step 1 diagram step2_label Label step 2 diagram step3_label Label step 3 diagram step4_label Label step 4 diagram step5_label Label step 5 diagram show_percentages Show percentage initial participants retained step show_exclusion_boxes Show side boxes exclusion counts reasons direction Direction diagram flow color_scheme Color scheme diagram elements show_interpretation Show explanatory text generated diagram

title: Subgroup Analysis Forest Plot ‚Äî subgroupforest
text: Creates forest plots showing treatment effects across different patient subgroups. Performs subgroup analysis clinical trials observational studies, calculating treatment effects within patient subgroups testing interactions. Supports survival (time--event), binary, continuous outcomes comprehensive statistical validation heterogeneity testing.

title: Subgroup Analysis Forest Plot ‚Äî subgroupforest
code: subgroupforest(   data,   outcome,   treatment,   subgroups,   time,   event,   outcomeType = "survival",   effectMeasure = "hr",   confidenceLevel = "0.95",   showOverall = TRUE,   showInteraction = TRUE,   sortBy = "effect",   showSampleSizes = TRUE,   logScale = TRUE,   nullLine = 1 )

title: Subgroup Analysis Forest Plot ‚Äî subgroupforest
text: data data data frame. outcome Primary outcome variable. survival analysis, time variable. binary outcomes, use 0/1 factor 2 levels. continuous outcomes, use numeric variables. treatment Treatment exposure variable (must binary: 0/1, control/treatment). variable defines two groups compared analysis. subgroups Variables defining patient subgroups analysis (categorical variables). variable analyzed separately identify differential treatment effects. Examples: age groups, gender, disease stage, biomarker status. time Time variable survival analysis (numeric, required outcomeType = "survival"). contain time event censoring consistent units (days, months, years). event Event indicator survival analysis (binary: 1=event occurred, 0=censored). Required survival analysis distinguish observed events censored observations. outcomeType Type outcome variable: "survival" (time--event), "binary" (yes/), "continuous". Determines statistical method used analysis (Cox regression, logistic regression, linear regression). effectMeasure Statistical measure treatment effect: "hr" (hazard ratio), "" (odds ratio),  "rr" (risk ratio), "md" (mean difference). match outcome type. confidenceLevel Confidence level intervals. showOverall Display overall treatment effect across patients. showInteraction Perform statistical tests subgroup interactions using likelihood ratio tests. Tests whether treatment effect varies significantly across subgroups. sortBy Method ordering subgroups plot: "effect" (effect size),  "n" (sample size), "alpha" (alphabetical). Affects visual presentation. showSampleSizes Display sample sizes subgroup. logScale Display effects log scale (recommended ratios: HR, , RR). Makes ratio effects interpretable symmetric around null value. nullLine Value null effect reference line (1 ratios: HR//RR, 0 differences: MD). Vertical line indicating treatment effect.

title: Subgroup Analysis Forest Plot ‚Äî subgroupforestClass
text: Creates forest plots showing treatment effects across different patient subgroups. function performs subgroup analysis clinical trials observational studies, calculating treatment effects within patient subgroups testing interactions. Supports survival (time--event), binary, continuous outcomes. Clinical Applications: Identify patient subgroups differential treatment benefit Test treatment--subgroup interactions Guide personalized treatment decisions Explore heterogeneity treatment effects Statistical Methods: Survival outcomes: Cox proportional hazards models (Hazard Ratios) Binary outcomes: Logistic regression (Odds Ratios, Risk Ratios) Continuous outcomes: Linear regression (Mean Differences) Interaction testing: Likelihood ratio tests

title: Subgroup Analysis Forest Plot ‚Äî subgroupforestClass
text: results object containing forest plot, summary tables, interaction tests

title: Subgroup Analysis Forest Plot ‚Äî subgroupforestClass
text: Effect Measures Outcome Type: Survival Outcomes: Hazard Ratio (HR): Compares hazard rates treatment groups HR > 1: Increased hazard (worse outcome) treatment HR < 1: Decreased hazard (better outcome) treatment Binary Outcomes: Odds Ratio (): Compares odds outcome groups Risk Ratio (RR): Compares probability outcome groups /RR > 1: Higher risk treatment /RR < 1: Lower risk treatment Continuous Outcomes: Mean Difference (MD): Difference means groups MD > 0: Higher values treatment MD < 0: Lower values treatment Interaction Testing: Tests whether treatment effect varies significantly across subgroups using likelihood ratio tests comparing models without interaction terms. Sample Size Requirements: Minimum 5 patients per subgroup analysis Larger samples recommended stable estimates Consider multiple comparison adjustments many subgroups

title: Supervised Principal Components Cox Regression ‚Äî superpc
text: Supervised Principal Components (SuperPC) Cox regression high-dimensional data. method first screens features using univariate Cox regression, applies PCA selected features, finally fits Cox model using principal components. Particularly effective genomics data many features correlated.

text: data survey dataset analyzed, provided data frame. Must contain survival variables, survey design variables (weights, strata, clusters), explanatory variables analysis. elapsedtime numeric variable representing follow-time event last observation. Time consistent units across observations. tint true, survival time calculated diagnosis follow-dates. false, elapsedtime provided pre-calculated numeric variable. dxdate Date diagnosis start follow-. Required tint = true. Must match format specified timetypedata. fudate Follow-date date last observation. Required tint = true. Must match format specified timetypedata. timetypedata Specifies format date variables input data. Used tint = true parse diagnosis follow-dates. timetypeoutput units survival time reported output. outcome outcome variable indicating event status (e.g., death, disease occurrence). outcomeLevel level outcome considered event. weights Variable containing survey sampling weights observation. Required survey-weighted analysis. strata Variable defining survey strata. Used stratified sampling designs. cluster Variable defining primary sampling units clusters. Used cluster multi-stage sampling designs. fpc Variable containing finite population correction factors. Optional improved variance estimation sampling fraction large. design_type Type survey sampling design used collect data. nest_clusters Whether clusters nested within strata (TRUE) crossed (FALSE). Relevant stratified cluster designs. explanatory Categorical explanatory variables weighted Cox regression. contexpl Continuous explanatory variables weighted Cox regression. km_weighted Perform survey-weighted Kaplan-Meier survival estimation. cox_weighted Perform survey-weighted Cox proportional hazards regression. robust_se Use robust variance estimation accounting survey design effects. ci_level Confidence level confidence intervals (e.g., 0.95 95\ population_totalsCalculate population-level survival estimates totals. subpopulationVariable defining subpopulation domain estimation. km_plotGenerate survey-weighted Kaplan-Meier survival plot. endplotMaximum follow-time display survival plots. byplotTime interval plot labels risk tables. ci95Display confidence intervals survival plots. risktableDisplay number risk survival plots. design_summaryDisplay summary survey design characteristics. showSummariesDisplay natural language summaries alongside tables plots interpretation survey-weighted survival results. showExplanationsDisplay detailed explanations survey-weighted survival methods interpretation guidelines. results object containing:

title: Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART) for Survival ‚Äî survivalbart
text: data data data frame. time Time event variable (numeric). right-censored data,  time study entry event censoring. event Event indicator variable. survival analysis: 0 = censored, 1 = event. Binary coding required current BART implementation. predictors Variables include BART survival model. Can include numeric, ordinal, nominal variables. BART automatically handles variable types interactions without preprocessing. strata Optional stratification variable stratified survival analysis. Creates separate BART models stratum. model_type Type survival model. AFT models log-survival times directly, PH models log-hazard ratios, cure models handle long-term survivors mixture cured susceptible populations. prior_distribution Prior distribution error terms AFT model. Normal corresponds log-normal survival times, extreme value Weibull survival, logistic log-logistic survival. n_trees Number trees BART ensemble. trees provide greater flexibility increase computation time. 100-300 typical range. alpha Controls tree depth splitting probability. Higher values favor shallower trees, lower values allow deeper trees complex interactions. beta Controls tree depth splitting probability formula. Higher values discourage deep splits, promoting simpler trees. k Scale parameter terminal node prior. Controls magnitude individual tree contributions overall ensemble. q Quantile error variance prior specification. Higher values assume less noise survival process. nu Degrees freedom inverse chi-square prior error variance. Lower values allow uncertainty variance estimation. n_burn Number burn-MCMC iterations discard. sufficient convergence stationary distribution. n_post Number posterior MCMC iterations keep inference. iterations provide precise posterior estimates. n_thin Keep every nth posterior sample reduce autocorrelation. Higher values reduce effective sample size may improve mixing. n_chains Number independent MCMC chains. Multiple chains enable convergence diagnostics robust posterior inference. variable_selection Include variable selection probabilities BART model. Automatically identifies relevant predictors reduces overfitting irrelevant variables. sparse_prior Use sparse Dirichlet prior variable selection probabilities. Promotes sparser models fewer active variables. selection_alpha Concentration parameter Dirichlet prior variable selection probabilities. Higher values favor uniform selection. predict_times Comma-separated list time points survival probability predictions. Empty string uses data-driven quantiles. survival_quantiles Comma-separated list quantiles survival time predictions. Provides percentile-based survival time estimates. credible_level Level posterior credible intervals estimates. 0.95 provides 95\ cross_validationPerform k-fold cross-validation assess --sample performance model generalization. cv_foldsNumber folds cross-validation. folds provide better performance estimates increase computation. convergence_diagnosticsCompute MCMC convergence diagnostics including effective sample sizes, autocorrelation, potential scale reduction. posterior_predictionPerform posterior predictive checks assess model adequacy comparing observed data posterior predictive distributions. show_model_summaryDisplay comprehensive model summary including BART parameters, convergence diagnostics, posterior summaries. show_variable_importanceDisplay variable importance measures based selection frequencies splitting criteria across trees. show_survival_summaryDisplay survival function summaries including median survival times survival probabilities key time points. show_convergenceDisplay MCMC convergence diagnostics chain mixing assessment model validation. plot_survival_curvesPlot individual population-level survival curves posterior credible bands showing uncertainty. plot_variable_importanceCreate variable importance plot showing inclusion probabilities splitting frequencies across ensemble. plot_traceGenerate trace plots key model parameters assess MCMC convergence mixing. plot_posterior_predictiveCreate posterior predictive check plots comparing observed survival patterns model predictions. plot_partial_dependenceGenerate partial dependence plots showing marginal effects individual variables survival hazard. plot_interactionsVisualize detected interactions variables strength confidence measures. probit_linkUse probit link binary outcomes cure models. Alternative logit link mixture component modeling. cure_fraction_priorPrior distribution cure fraction cure models. Uniform non-informative, Jeffreys scale-invariant. adaptive_scalingUse adaptive scaling MCMC proposals optimize acceptance rates improve sampling efficiency. parallel_chainsRun MCMC chains parallel faster computation multiple chains specified. memory_optimizationUse memory-efficient storage large ensembles datasets reduce memory footprint. random_seedRandom seed reproducible MCMC sampling tree ensemble generation. results object containing:

title: Survival Analysis for Continuous Variable ‚Äî survivalcont
text: data data data frame. elapsedtime time--event follow-duration patient. numeric continuous, measured consistent units (e.g., months years). Can calculated automatically dates using date options . tint Enable option want calculate survival time dates data. useful separate columns diagnosis date follow-date want calculate time elapsed . dxdate date diagnosis study entry. Accepts: (1) Date/datetime text (e.g., "2024-01-15"), (2) Numeric Unix epoch seconds (DateTime Converter's corrected_datetime_numeric output), (3) Numeric datetime values R. Time intervals calculated difference follow-date. fudate date last follow-event. Accepts: (1) Date/datetime text (e.g., "2024-01-15"), (2) Numeric Unix epoch seconds (DateTime Converter's corrected_datetime_numeric output), (3) Numeric datetime values R. Must format diagnosis date. contexpl continuous explanatory variable used analysis. outcome outcome variable used analysis. outcomeLevel level outcome variable represents event interest. dod . dooc . awd . awod Select levels outcome variable correspond different event types data. example, might separate levels "Dead Disease" "Alive w Disease" survival analysis cancer patients. analysistype Select type survival analysis perform. "Overall" survival analysis considers events equivalent, "Cause Specific" analysis distinguishes different event types. "Competing Risk" analysis accounts competing risks may prevent event interest occurring. cutp Specify time points survival probability calculations. default "12, 36, 60"  represents 1, 3, 5 years (compatible literature standards). can customize  values entering comma-separated time points (e.g., "6, 18, 30"  6 months, 18 months, 30 months). Use "default" restore standard 1,3,5-year analysis. timetypedata select time type data timetypeoutput select time type output uselandmark Enable option perform landmark survival analysis specified time point. landmark Specify landmark time evaluate survival probabilities landmark analysis. option available enable "Use Landmark Time" option. sc Enable option create Kaplan-Meier survival plot continuous explanatory variable. kmunicate Enable option create KMunicate-style survival plot continuous explanatory variable. ce Enable option create plot cumulative events time continuous explanatory variable. ch Enable option create plot cumulative hazard time continuous explanatory variable. endplot Specify end time survival plots. option determines maximum time point include plots. ybegin_plot Specify starting value y-axis survival plots. option allows customize range y-axis. yend_plot Specify ending value y-axis survival plots. option allows customize range y-axis. byplot Specify time interval survival plots. option determines spacing tick marks x-axis. findcut Enable option automatically find optimal cut-point continuous explanatory variable using maximally selected rank statistic. option available enable "Survival Plot" option. optimal cut-point displayed survival plot vertical dashed line. multiple_cutoffs Enable option find multiple optimal cut-points continuous explanatory variable. extends single cutoff analysis identify 2-4 optimal cut-points maximize survival group separation. Creates stratified groups enhanced survival analysis. num_cutoffs Select number cut-points identify. create multiple risk groups stratified survival analysis (e.g., 2 cut-offs create Low, Medium, High risk groups). cutoff_method Method finding multiple cut-offs. Quantile-based uses tertiles/quartiles, Recursive finds sequential optimal points, Tree-based uses survival trees, Minimum P-value finds points minimize log-rank p-values. min_group_size Minimum percentage patients required group created cut-offs. Prevents creating groups insufficient sample sizes reliable analysis. multievent Enable option data includes multiple event levels (e.g., different types events outcomes). option required cause-specific competing risk survival analyses. ci95 Enable option display 95\ survival estimates plots. risktable Enable option display table risk estimates group survival analysis. censored Enable option display censored observations survival plots. medianline true, displays line indicating median survival time survival plot. person_time Enable option calculate display person-time metrics, including total follow-time incidence rates. metrics help quantify rate events per unit time study population. time_intervals Specify time intervals stratified person-time analysis. Enter  comma-separated list time points create intervals. example,  "12, 36, 60" create intervals 0-12, 12-36, 36-60, 60+. rate_multiplier Specify multiplier incidence rates (e.g., 100 rates per 100 person-years, 1000 rates per 1000 person-years). rmst_analysis Enable Restricted Mean Survival Time (RMST) analysis. RMST provides average  survival time specified time horizon, useful median survival undefined. rmst_tau Specify time horizon RMST calculation. left 0, use 75th percentile  observed survival times. represents maximum follow-time RMST calculation. residual_diagnostics Enable Cox model residual diagnostics including Martingale, Deviance, Score,  Schoenfeld residuals. Useful checking model assumptions identifying outliers. stratified_cox Enable stratified Cox regression analysis. allows different baseline hazards  across strata maintaining proportional hazards within strata. strata_variable Variable use stratification Cox regression. categorical variable  defines different risk groups populations. loglog Enable log-log plot assessing proportional hazards assumption. Parallel lines  log-log plot suggest proportional hazards assumption holds. showExplanations Display detailed explanations analysis component help interpret statistical methods results. showSummaries Display natural language summaries alongside tables plots. summaries provide plain-language interpretations statistical results. Turn reduce visual clutter summaries needed.

title: Survival Analysis for Continuous Explanatory Variable ‚Äî survivalcontClass
text: function provides advanced survival analysis specifically designed continuous explanatory variables. includes: Core Features: Optimal cut-determination using maximally selected rank statistics Multiple cut-offs analysis 4 different methods (quantile, recursive, tree-based, minimum p-value) Person-time analysis interval stratification Date-based time calculation multiple format support Multiple event level support (overall, cause-specific, competing risks) Landmark analysis time-dependent effects Advanced Analytics: Restricted Mean Survival Time (RMST) analysis Cox model residual diagnostics (Martingale, Deviance, Score, Schoenfeld) Log-log plots proportional hazards assessment Enhanced error handling data validation Visualization Options: Kaplan-Meier survival curves optimal cut-offs Multiple cut-offs histogram cut-point annotations Cumulative events hazard plots KMunicate-style plots publication Residual diagnostic plots (4-panel layout) Log-log plots assumption checking

Multiple cut-offs analysis with different methods result2 <- survivalcont(   data = lung,   elapsedtime = "time",   outcome = "status_binary",   contexpl = "ph.karno",   multiple_cutoffs = TRUE,   num_cutoffs = "three",   cutoff_method = "recursive",   min_group_size = 15,   sc = TRUE )  # RMST analysis with residual diagnostics result3 <- survivalcont(   data = lung,   elapsedtime = "time",   outcome = "status_binary",   contexpl = "wt.loss",   findcut = TRUE,   rmst_analysis = TRUE,   rmst_tau = 500,   residual_diagnostics = TRUE,   loglog = TRUE )  # Person-time analysis with date calculation # Create sample data with dates set.seed(123) n <- 200 sample_data <- data.frame(   biomarker = rnorm(n, 100, 25),   event = rbinom(n, 1, 0.6),   dx_date = as.Date("2020-01-01") + sample(0:365, n, replace = TRUE),   fu_date = as.Date("2020-01-01") + sample(366:1095, n, replace = TRUE) )  result4 <- survivalcont(   data = sample_data,   tint = TRUE,   dxdate = "dx_date",   fudate = "fu_date",   timetypedata = "ymd",   timetypeoutput = "months",   outcome = "event",   contexpl = "biomarker",   person_time = TRUE,   time_intervals = "6, 12, 24",   rate_multiplier = 1000,   calculatedtime = TRUE )  # Comprehensive analysis with all features result5 <- survivalcont(   data = lung,   elapsedtime = "time",   outcome = "status_binary",   contexpl = "meal.cal",   findcut = TRUE,   multiple_cutoffs = TRUE,   num_cutoffs = "two",   cutoff_method = "quantile",   rmst_analysis = TRUE,   rmst_tau = 400,   residual_diagnostics = TRUE,   person_time = TRUE,   time_intervals = "100, 300, 500",   sc = TRUE,   ce = TRUE,   ch = TRUE,   kmunicate = TRUE,   loglog = TRUE,   ci95 = TRUE,   risktable = TRUE,   calculatedcutoff = TRUE,   calculatedmulticut = TRUE ) } # text: data data data frame patientId Patient identifier variable startDate Treatment start date baseline time (Date numeric) lastFollowup Last follow-date time progressionDate Date/time disease progression (required accurate PFS/TTP/DOR) deathDate Date/time death (required accurate OS/PFS) deathEvent Death event indicator (0=alive, 1=dead). needed death date provided. progressionEvent Disease progression indicator (0=progression, 1=progression). needed progression date provided. treatmentEnd Treatment end date (optional, time treatment calculation) responseDate Date confirmed response (optional, DOR calculation) timeUnit Unit time calculations (numeric time variables) inputType Type input data (dates numeric time values) calculatePFS Calculate progression-free survival (time progression death) calculateOS Calculate overall survival (time death) calculateTTP Calculate time progression (censors death without progression) calculateDOR Calculate duration response (requires response date) calculateTOT Calculate time treatment (requires treatment end date) showDerivedData Display table derived survival endpoints showSummaryStats Display summary statistics endpoint showEventRates Display event rates censoring proportions showKMPlot Display simple Kaplan-Meier curves derived endpoints showMilestones Calculate survival specific time milestones milestones Comma-separated milestone times (selected time unit) exportEndpoints Export derived endpoints CSV use survival modules showUsageGuide Display guide using derived endpoints survival analysis
